description: Great little dive bar with fun atmosphere. All the staff who work there are super friendly and reasonably priced drinks are easy to find. Will absolutely come back again.
author: George S.

description: Great dives are made, not born. But some of them have that special quality that only real aficionados de drink can discern: a penchant for real people. None of that sour dour snooty hipster vibe. Just a neighborhood bar for the neighbors where you can still get a 6 dollar Bulleit bourbon and rant about the game on TV.
author: Octavio S.

description: This is a pretty good dive bar. Not much to say other than the drinks are pretty cheap compared to other bars in the area.
author: Alexander H.

description: Super grimy local bar. Great for a quick drink or an old nighter. Definitely smells like home you know, a little barfy  they have your typical beer and a shot specials
author: Natalie M.

description: 5$ for a Victoria and a shot of Jameson, cant beat that at all. Chill bearded bartender and cool artwork. Great Place.
author: Edson N.

description:
Very unfriendly Asian bartender lied to
Me and said it was shots only had to get my friend to buy me a drink
author: Joseph C.

description: EXTREMELY intoxicated Asian girl laying on the bar for more than 10 minutes trying to act sexy (it wasn't) gets told to get off bar eventually, (bartender didn't seem to care) she goes to get on top of one of the bar tables, but she was kinda overweight so the bar table flipped over and she fell on her ass. Still didn't get kicked out. Then proceeded to yell at her friends she was with and drink more. Obv she knew the bartender but wow behave like that I would assume your cut off or kicked out, nah they just didn't care. I've been kicked out bars for breathing wrong. Won't be back.
author: Francesca D.

description: Bloody Mary Review - If you haven't yet had a bloody mary from Thieves Tavern, I'm pretty sure you've been living under a booze deprived rock. But just in case. Here's the story. Fully stacked with bar olives, cheese cubes, bacon, pepperoncini, pickle, salami, cherry tomato, and pickled green beans, this bloody mary restores all your previous night's losses with a cheesy, meaty surplus of rejuvenation. Add in just a splash of stout beer and a big dose of hot sauce, and you'll be back at it in no time. Why go? Rejuvenation. | Price: $8
author: Shelley B.

description: Two pool tables, giant screen tv, a couple other tvs, photo booth and Internet jukebox! Also a good selection of beer and whiskey. Small, full of regulars, nice neighborhood bar. Smallish shots for the price.
author: Douglas A.

description:
This place is an excellent neighborhood dive bar. I came here on a rainy Saturday night to say goodbye to a friend, and was really pleasantly surprised at how awesomely affordable this bar is. It's also quite spacious, and according to my friend, this place is normally a bit more empty than it was on that packed rainy night. 

My favorite parts of this bar:
-Cheap, cheap, cheap drinks!! $5 draft beers, and cocktails are in the single or low double digits. Pretty impressive. 
-Pretty spacious and clean. The entrance feels a bit tight, but the back of the bar is super super spacious, there are some pool tables and photo booths, all neat stuff. Also mosts dive bars I go to always feel disgusting, but this place felt fine. 

Overall, an awesome, low key way of hanging out with friends without breaking your wallet. Dope.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Came here for a Bloody Mary at 4:50p and was told it's too late for a Bloody Mary. Um, ok? Mr Dickhead Bartender apparently wasn't aware people are encouraged to come here for Bloody Marys.
author: Emily C.

description:
If you're looking for a cool a.f. bar in the mission/soma that's not filled with dude bros, come here! If you are a dude bro, then please stay away. 

Had to kill some time before a show at Public Works, so I stopped in for a bevvy or two. I had been trekking in the sun and on the chalkboard it said they had fresh squeezed margaritas- haaay. Ponied up to the bar and got one- it was very good/ fresh/strong. The bartender was so cool as well- she didn't roll her eyes at having to make a margarita and she interacted with everyone with a good attitude. Place definitely has a dive element to it- but that's just the way i like it. Not sure about ppl complaining about prices- had 2 margies and a beer and our total was 17- pretty decent if you ask me. I kinda wished I wasn't so shy and i had bought a tank top- oh well- gives me a reason to go back!
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Thieves Tavern is a cute little dive with the friendliest bartenders in town and great, strong drinks. Famous for their bacon bloody Mary (Sat & Sun, noon-5). Juke box, pool tables...
If you're eating across the street at Mission Beach Cafe, pop in while you wait and enjoy delicious libations and good company.
author: Sarah B.

description:
If you like bloody marys, you have to visit Thieves on a weekend day for the phenomenal bacon bloody. I stopped in for a round with some friends on a Sunday afternoon, and it was well worth the outing. Hell, it was almost worth the visit from L.A. all on its own.

The bar was quiet when we went, at like 2:00 on a Sunday. It felt comfortabtly divey, with pool tables and bad lighting and plain decor. We got our drinks then seated ourselves at one of the many empty tables. Service was great. There was one bartender on duty, and she made us our bloodys with plenty of flair. I enjoyed watching her mix mine, taste it, then add more hot sauce.

The bloody mary is a marvel, one of the best and most over-the-top I've had in a long career as a bloody mary fiend. It was spicy and thick, which is how like I like them, and I definitely saw the bartender squirt in some sriracha. It would've been a great bloody mary even with a standard celery garnish, but it came with a ludicrous skewer heavy with pickles--red pepper, green bean, pearl onion, cornichon--as well as cheese, salami, and candied bacon. Every bite was delicious, pairing well with the soup of the mary. That candied bacon was particularly splendid, and I loved the snap of the green bean and that sweet, tart cornichon. This drink was really an appetizer in a glass, absolutely delightful, and a steal at $9. Just remember to bring cash.

Thieves is high on my list of places to revisit on future trips to San Francisco. Next time I'd like to come for lunch and order five bloody marys in lieu of an entree. Can't say how that'd go in the evening, but it would make for an excellent afternoon.
author: Steph C.

description:
We were waiting for our name(s) to be called at Mission Beach Cafe and concluded that with 16 people ahead of us, we had definitely had enough time to chug some drinks before brunch. I was craving Bloody Mary's, like badly so I yelped 'Bloody Mary's' and Thieves Tavern was .02 miles away.

It's a dive bar. 18.00 for 2 Bloody Mary's and I was buzzzzz'd off of 1. You drink, you chill, you talk, you leave. It's a dive bar in San Francisco in the Mission with 2 drunk guys slurring over their words and mumbling gibberish - that's that San Francisco dive bar feels.


Question: Would I drink here again? 
Verdict: Yes
Why?: Bloody Mary's were pretty on-point and service was quick and friendly.

Cheers!
C.
author: Carolyn H.

description:
San Fran is filled with good bars and I was impressed by everywhere I went. 
Thieves Tavern was a stop we made when looking for food, only to find they didn't serve any, but that didn't really matter. 

There was a pool table in the back and the room was filled with the usual hipster crowd you find in that area, so we felt pretty at home. 

There was nothing overly special about the bar, good booze, killer music, easy-going clientele, but the stand out for me was the bartender. He was fantastic. Personable, took time to chat, shared his fries, made good drinks. He totally made the experience and he's the reason I'd go back. 

As dive bars go, it was pretty alright. As bartenders go, he was great!
author: Alice N.

description:
$7 for shot of whiskey (depends on day you roll-jameson, bulleit, ???) & a 16-ounce PBR can = MONEY!

I love the simplicity of this place. Literally like 5 different drinks, PBR, two pool tables, and two t.vs playing something random. 

This is a dive-bars dive-bar, and I love it ....
author: Roman V.

description: Great dive bar. I know it's one of the best in the area, because I spotted one of my favorite bartenders at another bar here when I first stopped in here. Considering how busy the mission is, it's nice to have a bar in one of the quieter areas. And it's actually really close to my temple, so on Friday nights, I sometimes come here for a drink before I head home. Just a bar and serious about their drinking, but not all about fancy cocktails for Googlers. That's why I come here. To drink with my fellow artists and miscreants.
author: David A R.

description:
One of my favorite dive bars in SF. I came here with a group of friends yesterday, and had a great time. The bartender was so chill and friendly, and helped me charge my phone. 

Low lighting, comfy seating, and excellent music-a lot of Morrissey and 80's. There is a pool table and a photo booth. Drinks are strong and cheap (for SF). Cocktails are around $8, and they had a few drink specials. They accept Visa and MasterCard (no Amex). A very chill spot that I would definitely frequent if I lived in the Bay Area.
author: Alyssa F.

description: This place ranks up there in the best dive bar's I have ever been to. There is some inimitable vibe that a bar like this gives off. It draws fun people to the bar and fun people behind the bar. It's dark, has pool, has cheap drinks and makes me want to pull up a bar stool and never leave.
author: Andrew B.

description: Friendly bartenders, lots of bar seating, 2 pool tables and some booths. Decently priced bloody Mary's but it wasn't very good. The toppings were the best part... It had cheese, salami, bacon, a pickle and a pepper. The pickled green bean garnish was a nice touch. We ordered 2 epic bloody Mary's for $18. They overfill the cup with ice so it was pretty watered down. The tomato base wasn't strong enough either.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
This place is awful. They have last call at 1:45 and tried kicking us out at 1:50. One of the bartenders--the only lady one--aggressively hovered over us and demanded we down our drinks, five minutes after we bought them. One of my friends--who had two beers prior--said we just got them and the bartender said my friend was being a bitch and proceeded to grab her and my drinks out of our hands. She tried taking all my friends' drinks and intentionally poured beer all over me. The bartender ended up breaking a glass, and intentionally used my friend's jacket to wipe up the shards and spilled beer. Then they escorted me out and claimed I hit a the girl. My friends of course followed and did not finish their drinks. 

Do not come here if you want a beer. I will never come back again.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Wow. I was so hammered the last time I was here in 2007, that I totally forgot about it when i went again in 2014. GEEZUS CHRIST. 

And I was drinking vodka!?! gross!

I'm a whiskey gal now and can't stomach vodka. My how the times have changed.

On the last visit I had me some whiskey, watched some folks play pool, and I just thought I should warn y'all DO NOT reach under the molding going along the wall thinking there are hooks for your purses or coats. You know why?! There aren't any hooks. But what there is though, is a damn scorching hot pipe. So don't burn your fingers.
author: Susy C.

description:
03.15.14

Their $8 Bloody Mary is amazeballs.  The bacon is amazeball.  The cherry tomatoes are amazeballs.  I didn't know what to do with the lettuce, so I left it alone.

Do yourself a favor and have one.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thieves-tavern-san-francisco?select=J2wXtrTy8rZR7l9GJ8ibeQ#J2wXtrTy8rZR7l9GJ8ibeQ
author: Jenny L.

description: Like it.  Still has a non twitter-twat vibe; still feels like a San Francisco dive bar. Thank goodness.
author: Valerie M.

description: Major fail...came here because it's on my SF best Bloody Mary list but the BM is just a spicy drink with no garnishes, especially not the ones posted on Yelp. Total farce. I saw a pic on Yelp of the BM and it looked robust with bacon, olives, and romaine lettuce but when I got it, it looked frail and sad like my ex wife...sad story, Thieves. And the place was empyt! The lame bartender was cool - 1 star for you, Sucka MF!
author: Ghali A.

description:
Oh yea, Thieves Tavern, I like how you roll. You've got grunge. 

I went there on a weekday, and Thieves Tavern was filled with couples looking to stir up those intimate emotions. They've found just the place - the atmosphere here is a perfect balance of grunge and intimacy.

They've got a very good selection of beer (both on tab and in bottles). Places like this are usually staffed by snobby bartenders, but it's different here. They're pretty down to earth. 

The other reviews talk about their whiskey selection and Bloody Mary, which I've missed completely. I might just have to update my review give 'em 5-stars once I've had a chance to try those out.
author: Don L.

description:
My buddy used to work at nearby Photoworks so he brought almost the entire store with [us] when we went there. When you've got a crew, I sense this place is perfecto. 

The bartender was quite attractive. It's not overcrowded. I'd say it's not hipster but I was with the most hipster people there. I felt so cool for once. Photobooth. Weird movie projections. A couple screens with the Giants game. Inexpensive drinks. 

I'd definitely make it a neighborhood or post-work hangout if I were in San Fran.
author: Brian L.

description:
This place used to be a full fledged dive bar, with all the grunge, the mangy crowd, and the slightly cramped pool tables, and cheap drinks. It still has all the ambiance but now the menu is a bit more like a hipster beer bar. Paying $20, with tip, for two beers takes all the dive bar magic away.

I will say that it is almost always an adventure here, though! Two times ago a girl got kicked out of the bar for shooting up in the bathroom, and the last time two guys almost got in a fist fight over a pool game bet. Speaking of bathrooms, they are disgusting, even by dive bar standards. I've been in cleaner porta-potties at a music festival. Half of the time they have no soap. Sometimes I feel more dirty after I wash my hands than before.

On the bright side, the staff is always very friendly and accommodating, especially considering some of the things they have to deal with during any given night. 

Unfortunately it is getting hard to find even half way decent pool table bars in the city, so I will keep coming back for that reason alone.
author: Michael S.

description:
Jeff was our bartender & he is a Pro.  
This bar is a refreshing remanent of the Mission we used to know and love.
author: Mac S.

description: My number one reason for going to Thieves was to watch the Ravens game on a Sunday morning when I was visiting town. It's your typical dive bar with some decent specials. I'd go back.
author: Lauren K.

description:
The jukebox here alone has so much good stuff on it. I dunno if anyone recognized my selections but that's ok.

They also have a couple of pool tables, old school video games and cider. I'm sold.

Apparently, they're known for their whiskey so if that's your drink of choice, you should probably get your pretty little bum over here.

I dunno what else to tell you. The prices are reasonable and our friend became the rockstar hero of the day by bringing over some lemons and limes to the bartender. 

It's not on the main drag of the Mission so it seems to attract a lot of regulars. Not that that's a bad thing.
author: Amy J.

description: Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday night after a day being out. The place wasn't packed but had a good group. We sat at one of the booth that although a bit torn, add to the ambiance of this dive bar. They had Big Buck Hunter which I love and have rarely found in the city since moving from NY in March. Good dive-y atmosphere and music. A few drink specials that are worth it.
author: Gaby E.

description:
Hello dwellers of the Mission, and welcome to our sanctuary.  Welcome to our tavern*.

Years ago, it was us thieves** filling the seats of these booths, and it was us thieves vying for the attention of the woman at the bar (man, she was hot).  Sure, we let those guys from down the street use the pool table and arcade machine in the back (because they were huge), but this was still our bar.  Still our place to grab a pint or two.

Now?  I see you youngin's and so-called "hipsters" walk in more and more.  Some of my brethren look upon you as intruders and trespassers in our fortress of alcoholic solitude, taking our seats and talking to our women.  But the others, they see guests.  They see "business opportunities".  

So fear not friends.  Please, come in and have a drink.  Meet the friendly staff, enjoy the cheap alcohol, pick your favorite song on the jukebox, and have a good time.  We just ask that you remember to bring a full wallet, as the bar is cash only.  And because, like anyone else, thieves always enjoy a round of beer a little more when it's someone else's "treat"***.  

Welcome to Thieves Tavern.


*This actually is/was not my tavern.
**I'm not an actual thief.  Ninja maybe, but not a thief.
***Then again, who wouldn't?
author: Mike L.

description:
Thieves... a pretty legit little dive bar. 

I was here on a first date... strike that. A first date I had met on TINDER. Effing Tinder.

I had no idea what to expect. This was my first Tinder experience. Was he going to be a creep? A total letch and pervert? Was I going to have to splash a drink in his face?

To my surprise, he was well-behaved, well-spoken, and a genuinely sweet fellow. Not at all what I would expect from meeting someone from an internet dating-slash-hook-up site.

The bar serves up cheap-cheap-cheap drinks. If I had had to throw a whiskey ginger, it would not have been a huge loss, as it was super reasonably priced. 

There was a cute French bulldog perched upon a bar stool, and I immediately fell in love with him (his name was Roux). Super adorable, even when he continuously sneezed in my face. Perhaps my boozy breath was making him feel a bit ticklish in the nasal cavity. 

Minus one point for the women's bathroom not having any toilet paper when I went in there. I looked in the men's room (briefly, as the smell was overpowering). I did not see any in there either. I was a little tipsy at this point, so perhaps I had overlooked the secret stash of sanitary goods. 

My Monday night was super cool and the bartender was a really nice dude. Had I not been on a date, I might have flirted with him.

I guess old habits die hard. Once a floozy, always a floozy. ;)
author: Brandi W.

description:
Pilar is the bomb. This is still one of my favorite Bloody Mary's in San Francisco. I was tempted over by the BLT Bloody Marys she makes and the waffles. Yes, free waffles with bourbon whipped cream and honey butter. 

The Bloody Mary not only has bacon - but very unique spiciness and flavor. I love sitting at the bar and learning what goes into my drink.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Stolen.

Going rate for a cocktail in this town is a kind of ridiculous $10+.

Which made me give me pause when the bartender said $8 for two cocktails. Not during an early evening special but a little after 8pm. 

Do I owe someone money? Because at these prices think alcohol might have been stolen. 

Chill space. Great prices. Five legal stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
We found the tavern on yelp, just casually looking for a place to hang and grab a drink. Turns out, none of us really wanted a drink. So we just hung out (me with my seltzer water) and chatted.

The atmosphere was a little divey but overall friendly, and the bartender came by later to grab our glasses, a gesture I didn't expect but appreciated nonetheless. 

By the time we left, I still had had nothing, but the atmosphere left me feeling a little drunk on the night anyways. I intend on returning when I want liquor as well.
author: Rishikesh T.

description:
Definitely one of the top five bloody marys in sf

The top for me is Hi tops, second is benders, and third is thieves.
Mostly because I like meat in my mary and this one does not deliver
but their bloody mix is perfectly spicy and they are liberal with their garnish.
The bar tenders have always been great and their beer selection is choice.
I love the atmosphere of this place and even without a meaty mary it's still my favorite dive.
author: Molly S.

description:
Awesome bar, stumbled upon it while out drinking towards the end of the night. They make some very creative cocktails and have a good amount of beer on tap. The bartender has the best mustache ever, it was pretty badass. Very nice staff.

I am a fan of this place, another find in the mission!
author: Jonah K.

description:
I'm starting to find more and more ways to my heart. I'm sure I've listed them in my array of reviews across the years, They usually have something to do with feeding me.. Something about getting to my heart via my stomach.. Is that a dude thing? Sigh.. Alas.. 

Anyways, a damn good spicy Bloody Mary is apparently another one of these. Come here, garden of veggies and pig parts! Come run into my toothpick spear, and dip yourselves into this lovely swimming pool of vodka and tomato juice. Thieves can make a mean one. Bacon AND Salami. And.. wow, are those cubes of cheese?! YES. 

Note: there's beer in it too.

My loyalties with football are limited to three teams max. Yes, horrible, I know. NOT really that into it, but a friend of mine is a huge Ravens fan, so I've been here on some random Sundays since Thieves is a Ravens bar. They're exciting and fun. 

I approve. Now, hand me another Bloody Mary.
author: Donna H.

description:
Dive Bar!!!!!

We ordered Bloody Mary's because Yelpers have raved about them. 

When we got there the bartender told us she had no bacon or any of the yummy fixings for the Bloody Mary's that they are known for. We still ordered a basic one. It was below average in taste!!!

I am sure well drinks and beer are the best future choice, but not sure if we will be back.
author: Julie M.

description:
Not sure what's happened to the Mission in the past year, but I came here on a Saturday night a few weeks ago; it was Yuppie Heaven AND I was the only ethnic minority in a sea of whites. This blew my mind considering I was in the Mission.
I like that this place has $7 PBR+Whiskey combo and they have a pool table. However, for the love of god don't come here on a Saturday night if you're not hip and white. While I was in the middle of a conversation with my friend, a couple muttered "excuse me" and scooted to stand behind me, near the jukebox. I was wondering what the hell their problem was until I turned around and I realized they were snorting coke. There's a bathroom, you know.
Come on a weeknight for a good experience. I like this place, but Saturday nights... :(
author: Lori C.

description: Picked the right pub to spend New Years Eve on! This place is located at the end of a street of houses so the neighbourhood is pretty safe. Well drinks at $5 and a Special of a shot and a beer for $7. The bartenders were really fast and friendly and kept up with the huge multitude of people. They offered pool and played great music all night. There are tables as well as bar stools. The bartenders gave everyone free champagne at the New Years countdown. The bathrooms are decent and located in the back of the pub. The place is dim lit and very grunge which was exactly what I was looking for. The sign on the door outside says 'Cash Only' but they do accept cards. Security checks ID's outside, so make sure to have those ready!
author: Jarah T.

description:
DIVE BAR, DIVE BAR. DIVE! BAR!

Thieves is such a legitimate dive bar. You hang in there, Thievesy. Don't let the changing city change you.

Conversation overheard between bartenders:
Bartender A: "Do we even have simple syrup?"
Bartender B: *laughs* "No."

Also, this is the only bar I've been to where some guy is rad enough to buy a round of beers for the whole bar.

Thieves is the sh*t.
author: K M.

description:
A Pure Delight!!!

When looking for a dive, look no further!!

I ordered a Bacon Bloody Mary and substituted the TomJuice w Clamato!!

Let me tell you what!!

SooooooGood!!!!!

The Bacon Tastes Like Candaaaay!!!

Strawberries, Raspberries, All those good things!
author: Paul R.

description: Basically, thieves is da shit! I came in when Jeff was working and da game was on. We had all da drinks and all the specials!! I highly recommend coming here! There was this cute girl working before too I think her name was Alicia!!
author: Ali E.

description:
A solid local (as in locals who live within a three block radius) bar.  far enough removed from Valencia/Guererro/16th/17th that you don't get walk-ins or bridge and tunnels who only just realized the Mission isn't "scary" anymore.

Drinks are a good deal but not great given the "ambiance" but $7 for a well-poured Jameson and a tall can of PBR is just fine by me.

Good number of TVs (not huge but honestly, we're spoiled these days) and a great spot to catch the Giants.
author: Mike V.

description:
Quiet dive. 

I had the worst Manhattan I've ever had there and it took fifteen minutes to get. That said, I got a free shot out of it. That said, it was a shot of Jameson, so they might as well have slammed my thumb in a drawer instead. For my next drink, the bartender promised a special brand of bourbon -- that after much shuffling about -- they did not have. That said, they kept discounting the drinks, because they were so disorganized. That said, my date kept getting poked by pool cues and groped by (other) customers. That said, this isn't really a terrible bar, I just had a weird time there. 

I really don't know what to tell you. That said, I'll probably go back. 

Obligatory Title Pun: Whet a thief, to catch a THIEF. 

Menu Readability: Nope. 

Need to mention: Pool tables and and a photo booth for your amusement. 

What this place teaches me about myself: I will never spell "thief" correctly on the first try.
author: Vivek S.

description:
You'd have to imagine the defining elements of Thieves came from a circle of friends halfway through a handle of Evan Williams and/or a bag of lawn clippings.

"Let's put a photo booth in there."
"Yeah, yeah. And let's, um, dress up that old bitch Bloody Mary with a head of romaine, jerkified bacon, grape tomatoes and..."
"Cream cheese!"
"Yeah, cream cheese."
...
"And waffles."
"Free waffles."
"Free fucking waffles."

Pair that stoney conversation with a couple of pool tables, chipster (chipper hipster - you heard it here first) bar staff and $5 PBR/Jameson combos, and you've got where I want to drink.

See you tomorrow, friends.
author: Damien S.

description:
I dig this place. I'm hesitant to call anywhere a dive unless it seeks of misfortune and despair so let's just call Thieves a neighborhood joint. There is the token old dude hanging out by himself (but that just provides some character) and usually enough space to grab a table with friends and chat. If that's the sort of place you usually like hanging out, give Thieves a shot. 

My first visit here was a Wednesday night with the free grilled cheese and avocado sandwiches. That was great. It's not how a $12 sandwich would taste, but seriously San Francisco, there are enough places that provide that. Sometimes you just want something to munch on while you drink. Beer and a shot combo is pretty cheap too.
author: Kiran U.

description: I don't particularly like dive bars, but this one is one of my favorites. At the price you're paying for a drink (~$4/beer, $6 well drinks), it's a great deal.
author: Amy Y.

description:
I went there to hang out for a friend's birthday, it was fun.

The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because
-  It's a cash bar (no credit)
-  In that area it's hard to find parking Thursday to Saturday night.

But overall it was fun.  The well drinks I ordered were $5 each, decent price and had a decent amount of liquor in them.  There are two pool tables in the back that are coin operated. There was also an arcade game with some 80's games on it (including King Kong, Pacman, and Galaga on it).

It's a chill dive-y bar with decent ambiance, and the music isn't too loud that you can't think or talk to other people.
author: Mike L.

description: Love the bar hate the mess it leaves every night.  To the owner, please provide your customers with an ash tray.  The curb and street have become a giant ash tray.  CLEAN IT UP!
author: Michael G.

description: Great place, great drinks, great service!
author: Nicole L.

description: Okay place. Had an $8 Ommegang white ale. I've never seen a fridge jammed with PBR before.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Came here a few years ago, finally made my way back (twice) last week.

Wednesday night - rad happy hour. Got an anchor steam for $4 with a side of free grilled cheese with avocado (I omitted the tomatoes because tomatoes are evil. Go ahead, judge my tomato-hate).

Friday - it was pretty loud considering it was only 8 pm. Or maybe I can no longer make a joke about being a grandma? Maybe I've officially joined the 25-year-old grandma club?

Overall I like the vibe. It's not trying to be pretty, and I appreciate that. The mural behind the booths is interesting to look at. Plus it's just far enough away from the 16th street madness that it seems pretty legit local. 

I'll definitely be back, especially on a wednesday night. Grilled. Cheese. with. avocado.
author: Maggie F.

description: Kind of reminds me of my home bar. I give it 4 middle fingers out of 5 fistings!
author: Michael D.

description: Low key dive bar. Not super packed. Good to go with friends where you'll probably be able to find a table and chat.
author: Mel G.

description:
Awesome little place a quick jaunt from the Castro. Drinks are nicely priced here, where a draft beer and a rum/coke will only set you back $8.

Lots of little booths on the side and a pool table in the back. Never too crowded and not loud enough to not hear your drinkingmate.

Photobooth by the door!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Are thieves thick? I don't know, but Yelpers are, and when a certain element (real people who write real reviews and get real drunk) decide they like a place it becomes a cool place to be because that crowd brings the fun with 'em wherever they go. 

But really, they're pretty picky, and wouldn't hang out at Thieves if it didn't provide an awesome party backdrop with pool tables, fabulous classic jukebox, insanely delicious and creative Bloody Marys and festive staff. 

The useful: for gods sake get a Bloody Mary @ Thieves BEFORE having brunch at the nearby Mission Beach Cafe, where you cannot procure one.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
So am I starting to like  San Francisco?  I seem to be spending a lot of weekend time there, so one would think that I'm liking it, right?  Not so much.  But with places like Thieves Tavern I'm warming up to it.  

I attended Blueberry Alarm Clock (congrats to Dru and Pilar on such a great event).  Because I was the first to show up I got two drinks on the house.  First I ordered the virgin Bloody Mary.  All I can say is that I wasn't missing the alcohol.  That thing is like drinking a salad, but spicy! Please see the pics, yes that is bacon.  And, oddly enough, it's the first time I didn't have to complain about something not being hot enough!  My second drink was the beloved gin and tonic. It was strong!  I want to thank Pilar D.  for making me feel welcome and pouring great drinks!  And to the "man with the waffle iron," Mr. J, for making sweet, sweet waffles.  You get them free with your drinks. Today's sauce was peanut sauce and cinnamon whipped cream.  Very tasty.

The piece de resistance had to be the blueberry-lemon pancakes with blueberry sauce.  Just the right amount of sweetness and tanginess. I ended up getting four!  I want Dru making all my pancakes!  But that's for another review. :-)
author: Courtney S.

description:
I was here for a special appearance by the great Pilar and hulky Dru. Their famous bloody-marys were quite the bomb. I also loved that it had a "BLT" in the drink !!! Strips of bacon wrapped around cherry tomatoes on a skewer, with a huge lettuce leaf.

The drinks were reasonably priced and the owner (I think) Jay was more than reasonable in allowing a bunch of folks to storm in and set up a tailgate party of sorts (Dru and his merry band of pancakes elves). I loved that the owner/bartender thought people getting hammered at 3:00pm was effing awesome! LOL!

Oh the owner also serves free pancakes with strawberries and cream on Saturday mornings through the early afternoon hours.

The DPT doused my flamin' fun with a parking ticket. Oh well! 
All in all, it was a fantastic Saturday afternoon well spent. Awesome place, awesomer people !
author: Umesh T.

description:
Bigger than Whiskey Thieves (but a shoebox is bigger than WT) and pretty freaking cool. 

Also $4 rum and diets? NICE!
author: Emily D.

description:
Best. Bloody Mary. Ever. Or should I say, BLT Bloody Mary because it comes adorned with bacon, lettuce, tomatoes and cream cheese! I've had some awesome bloody's in my time and TT's blew them out of the water. 

BF and I came here Saturday morning for a special treat: free strawberry pancakes! They were making them from scratch right there at the bar and my God were they good. Apparently they serve waffles every Saturday morning but the pancakes were a special event. I think this is going to be our new favorite breakfast spot and damn is it an unlikely one. 

P.S. Two pool tables in the back - get your game on!
author: Julia N.

description:
Do you remember that "Friends" episode where Rachel messes up the trifle by mixing it with the recipe for Shepherd's Pie?  Joey is the only one who likes it: "I mean, what's not to like? Custard, good. Jam, good. Meat, good!"

While I'm not always a fan of the Bloody Mary (by the way, February 8th was the 423rd anniversary of the execution of Mary, Queen of Scots), there are occasions where a Bloody Mary is in order: "I mean, what's not to like?  Bacon, good.  Tomato, good.  Cream Cheese, good.  Vodka, good!"

To be quite honest, I may have never come here if it wasn't for Pilar's guest bartending stint.  As I was getting beautified that afternoon, I managed to arrive just as she was finishing her shift, so I didn't get to see her in action.  I did, however, get to hang out with a bunch of people I like, MEET VALERIA FINALLY, and get an infamous Bloody Mary made by one of the other cool bartenders.  

Pool tables?  Good.

Friends?  Good.

Guest bartender?  Can I have a shot...I'm good.
author: Pam S.

description: Not as dive-y as expected...more of just a dump....tap selection was average and drinks were eh.....
author: Zara S.

description: Great night with a fantastic bunch of people and the majority of the staff were excellent. My main issue with the place is the incredibly rude manager who decided that our entire group (10+) had to leave with no notice- after sitting happily for the evening we were abruptly evicted without warning, which included a recent order being confiscated with no notice. Very unhappy with the level of service and will not be returning or recommending this place any time soon
author: John M.

description:
Dark, divey, an impressive and surprising selection of fine bourbons. 

We went in on a Saturday afternoon and the bartender was a friendly bearded fellow. Pool table, jukebox and photo booth -- all the standard bar devices. Nothing special. 

It's cool, dark place to escape the blistering sun of the micro climate of the Mission. Wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but would definitely be a regular if I lived in the neighborhood.
author: Crystal J.

description:
So far, my favorite dive bar in the city, Wednesday and Thursday happy hours are the bomb.com with free grilled cheese sandwiches with tomato and avocado for the former, and quesadillas for the latter. Laid back atmosphere, cool people, great time. Perfect place for hump day.

CASH ONLY!
author: Timorei A.

description:
I'm a customer who appreciates customer appreciation. I also dig businesses that watch their Yelp reviews, makes me feel like my mouthing off is doing some good in the world.

The homegirl Pilar was name dropped in a review or four and Thieves picked up on it. 

From what was posted they figured this Pilar chick might roll through with some good times, so they tossed up a 10 cent bloody mary special in her honor for like 5 hours on a Sunday. They didn't do it at awkward times on a Tuesday at noon or something shady, they chose Sunday, the drinking day of all drinking days.

They did not fuck around with these bloody marys either, oh no. Kettle One, garnish, the works. As if a 10 cent bloody mary wouldn't have wooed me over, out comes a round of shots for Pilar's crew on the house.

Does this even happen anymore? Bars that give a shit what people say, do something to make the people happy, and then go above and beyond even that? If it happens often I'm not seeing it.

I'd been here once before and would have said 3 or 4 stars. Pool table is slick and they have some TVs for my NFL addiction. Comfy booths too. But something about this last visit makes me feel a lot more love. It's not that the booze was cheap. The bartender was so friendly the whole time, chatting us up, and in general made Pilar and all her posse feel appreciated. As I said, I appreciate customer appreciation, and Thieves certainly knows how to do just that.
author: Justin N.

description: This place is sincerely a delight as long as you can get seating.I like the atmosphere, the drink prices are fair , good music . Not so amateur night feeling despite being in the heat of the Mission drinking scene . But there besides stools at the bar , being very few tables to sit at is an airrrrrballlll in my book. Other than that I really like this place a bunch
author: Lauren V.

description: Disgraceful service. Barman did not want to be there. Couldn't leave fast enough. Juke box is a joke good luck if you're song plays...cannot emphasise how much the service and character was a joke
author: Paul C.

description: played pool in here a few times im a fan
author: Leigh G.

description:
The same guy that also owns Whiskey Thieves and Dirty Thieves owns this bar. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/whiskey-thieves-san-francisco#hrid:iD4HsCioXn02gPph_k6HTQ/src:self 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/dirty-thieves-san-francisco#hrid:PHAboVHKB2z9CtS-2P6lIw/src:self 

If he owns any other bars currently I'm not aware of it. 

I like all three of these bars and they are all in my rotation, if I had to rank them this one comes in at a close third. 

As many of you already know I organize a group on Meetup.com that goes to a different Mission bar every month and we have a lot of fun. The group is more successful than I ever anticipated. I expected that I'd get ten or fifteen regulars going to a different dive bar every month. I figured it would be mostly men and hopefully a couple of brave women. I was quite surprised when 30 people with almost an even male / female ratio showed up for my first event. The bartender got a little mad at me and told me I should have told the bar we were coming so they could staff up for the event; I learned my lesson. Now I'm bringing between 40 and 60 people to each event and make sure I set everything up ahead of time with the bar management. 

I had an event this Friday at Thieves Tavern and we all had a great time, seriously it was the most fun night I've had in ages. We packed the bar, I'm sure it was one of the best nights they ever had in sales. 

Here's the problem; while I really like these bars the management is too flaky and too hard to deal with. This time it took me two and a half months and five personal visits to the bar to confirm the date and details, something that could have been sorted out in a few timely emails. It took weeks for this guy to get back to me and when he did he never quite answered my questions completely. I'm basically working as a promoter for no pay and all I expect is timely communication and maybe a couple of free beers. They just make me work too hard to bring them business. 

Speaking of beer they could learn something from their sister bar Dirty Thieves and include a draft beer discount in their happy hour specials.
author: Manny F.

description:
It's divey - limited variety of beer... PBR was the most popular drink when we went there. But beyond all that, the crowd was very chill and the jukebox is great two. There are two pool tables and some tv screens.

I must say, from some traveling I have been doing, this has the best (nicest) bartenders! :)
author: Jessa G.

description:
What's the best way to wake up on a Saturday morning after late night? With a BLT Bloody Mary and a free waffle covered in whipped cream and maple syrup. Duh. 

Thieves puts other bars to shame, boasting not only an awesome take on one of my very favorite cocktails but super friendly bartenders, friendly patrons, a photo booth AND pool tables. Perfect bar in a bottle. I even scored a freebie this afternoon as a welcome to SF after a several month-long hiatus in NYC. 

The Bloody is made with a perfect combo of tomato, Worcestershire, horseradish, seasoning, a skewer of cherry tomatoes smeared with cream cheese, charred bacon and even a whole leaf of lettuce. 

While I rarely go here in the later evening time, I could - and have - easily spend all day at this dive on 15th and Guerrero.
author: Jane K.

description: So I enjoy dive bars .. I seek them out because they are all extremely different and there isn't one in the same. This bar we just walked up to seemed dingy from the outside. This doesn't bother me at all, however this part of the city is a bit more upscale, so you wouldn't expect that. The bar was actually closed during operating hours. We were kind of bummed hung out for a minute and then decided to venture on. Just as we were about to roll, this little Asian girl came running literally running up and threw a key in the door to open up. It seems there was a scheduling issue of some sort. Well I sure am glad that we caught her, 2 minutes later and we would have completely missed her. I helped her take the bar stools off the bar and she politely grabbed us a couple coldys while being a bit flustered because of the late start. What was interesting was the huge roll down movie screen. I really don't like those too much but the grainy screen with the football game on it had a nostalgia feel and worked in there. The bartender was cool enough to turn the game down and let us play the juke. We had a couple beers and took off. Definitely a cool spot. If I'm in the area again I will stop in. Good people and good vibes. :)
author: Jason C.

description:
People in Austin are snotty about Austin. People in SF are snotty about SF. Both parties are adamant that their city is the best. "Austin? In TEXAS? Never!" or Texans "California? The LEFT COAST? Never!" But sitting in Thieves Tavern, I had this moment where I felt like I was in Austin... in San Francisco. Of course, the bartender lived in Austin so that's more than likely why it was so awesome :)

There are three things you need to know about this spot:
A. Bloody Mary with bacon, cream cheese, cherry tomatoes and a huge leaf o lettuce
B. Free waffles with whiskey whipped cream. FREE
C. Jameson and a PBR is $7. 

Oh and bonus! A rad jukebox. Come here on a Saturday morning, grab a bloody and a waffle and listen to the sweet croonings of Hall and Oates. It's basically heaven with a little bacon thrown in.
author: Kelly S.

description:
On a Saturday night, if you are looking for a a solid bar with a great crowd, good tunes, and killer PBR specials.... THIS IS YOUR PLACE.

Thieves is a tiny spot in the Mission that has a solid atmosphere and a fully stocked bar that will please any drinkers palate.

The dingy booths, the cranky bartenders and the old pool table all add to the snarky character of this Mission spot. Expect sizable bathroom lines for either sex, as the bar tends to fill up after 1030 and the facilities get worked.

The 22 oz PBR, shot and a beer special, is a favorite. You can never go wrong with the combo.

Overall, after a single visit to Thieves, you'll understand why so many have become regulars. Do IT.
author: Justin O.

description: Who am I kidding? This is the best bloody mary in the entire city! No matter how much another bar or restaurant raves about their own version, it just doesn't hold a candle to Thieves (yes, even the goods at Zeitgeist!). If you're not spending your Saturdays here, you're missing out!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Third time's the charm!  Thanks to Liz C. for telling me that the bacon Bloody's are only on Saturdays.

OMG soooo good.  Rob, creator of the BLT Mary is chill and friendly, the bacon and produce is from Whole Foods, and the Mary is spicy!

Heaven on a Saturday morning.

Come early though, they WILL run out of bacon.
author: Yeeman N.

description: Here on an early Saturday evening for our first time! Perfect relaxed dive, pool tables, jukebox, and Photobooth. And street fighter machine! $3 well drinks, 2 TVs sportin the latest games - dark and loungey. After they played my boyfriend's favorite Titus Andronicus song, I have decided that I like it.
author: Chay T.

description:
This is a great neighborhood bar with all the trappings of a good one: booze, a photo booth (also broken when I went there last, is there a photo booth sabatoger out there?), a smattering of afternoon drinkers, and a subpar bathroom that makes you rethink your potty emergency. It's up there with the 500 Club, a standby bar closer to my casa.

Chill atmosphere, and since there isn't anything too hot happening around the bar itself, you're much more inclined to sit and stay a while. I've been again and again and will likely keep coming back.
author: Tara R.

description:
After all the great things I heard of this place, I REALLY wanted to fall in love it. 

Cool bartenders, a couple of pool tables, and a bunch of cozy nooks to creep into and drown your worries away with the help of a great selection of brew available on tap.

What's wrong what all that? 

Simple, this place gets PACKED. You're just as likely to find seating as you are to find Paris Hilton with her legs closed. Not happenin...
author: Kevin T.

description: I am so bummed. After seeing all the great reviews on here I was really excited about coming to Thieve's & trying their famous Bloody Mary. When we ordered our drinks they looked nothing like the ones here on yelp. But more importantly the drinks were actually disgusting. We took 3 sips & left. We literally could not drink them. I hope we just came in on a bad night..... But I probably won't go back to see.
author: Heather D.

description:
Best Bloody Mary Ever. It was spicy, but the kind of spicy that's FLAVOR spicy not just spicy hot. I'm so sad that we had gone to Thieves Tavern on Sunday because the free waffles with whiskey whipped cream are only served on Saturday - I'LL BE BACK FOR THOSE! 

The bartender was amazing. I'm so sad I cannot remember his name. I had mentioned that I was hungry and he whipped out a bunch of take-out menus and even suggested some things to order and where. He even added to the order with his own so it made it okay for us to eat outside food at the bar. 

Will definitely be coming back here!
author: Liz M.

description:
I work nearby and love visiting this place. Usually, the prices are right and the staff is friendly.

The gentlemen who served us until 5PM was quite friendly, serving us the Old Style and Jameson as the listed special. However, once he left, a young woman took over and the experience changed.

She began by ignoring us for 15 minutes. Then I asked for the special and she was very rude, making it clear the special had switched to Corona. I asked what was wrong and if I'd done anything to anger her and she barked at me saying "her mood was none of my business". 

I will still go here, since most of the staff is friendly, but would leave immediately if I saw this woman behind the bar.
author: Christopher J.

description:
This is my kind of place.

Incorporating different facets from some my favorite bars from back home, Thieves Tavern is a true neighborhood joint. Great music, friendly bartenders who have no problem doling out shots -- dangerooouuuss! -- a pool table and a setup conducive to group conversation and fun.

No, I didn't get to try the waffles. No, I didn't get to try their supposedly amazing Bloodies. But I'll be back to do both of those things, most likely. More than likely.

Bonus points for the photobooth and also, the borderline inappropriate channel advertising adult notions/toys as entertainment. There's something both fantastically cliché as well as hilarious about that.
author: Rachel F.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday night a couple months ago and I am so happy to write a 5 star review for it!

The thing that really stood out for the night was the service from the bartenders, particularly one funny-haired man named Jay. I was with a decent sized group and there was no fuss about us. I even got a ginger ale for my non-drinking friend free of charge. 

Another friend accidentally knocked over my three quarters-full beer later in the night and Jay graciously came over and helped us clean up, made a few jokes, and got me a new drink. So nice and unnecessary.

They also have good drinks, a jukebox for entertainment, and just an overall welcoming ambiance (minus some of the disturbing artwork on the walls).

Very happy with my experience :)
author: Holly S.

description:
There are plenty of bars in San Francisco, but not many like Thieves. A great selection of whiskey and beer, good pool tables, and pretty great music. Rarely crowded, a pretty mixed crowd, and not overrun by any of the normal Mission types (hipsters, walnut creek dwellers etc.). It's overall a really solid dive bar.

I mean, there's really not much you could do to improve it. Maybe clean up the bathrooms?
author: Matt J.

description: Spectacular side car. On a Friday night during PRIDE. Did I mention I sampled some whiskey too! Dive bar with 5 - star service.
author: Eric J.

description:
1 year, 52 yelp check-ins, 1 world series win, hundreds of tall PBRs and countless indecent photobooth poses later, i'm still smitten! 

the blt bloody marys and free waffles are just the icing on the cake; the real draw is the amazing crowd that this neighborhood gem attracts. 

friendly patrons, affordable booze, ample jukebox options, and charming bartenders. what's not to love?
author: Kristen A.

description:
Probably not a destination bar, but surely on the way to somewhere else, drop in for a couple. The staff are really what makes this place awesome, it was jam packed and there was only one tender. He announced to everyone hes trying his best and hopes to get everyone drunk Asap.  

The problem with this place is just the people... the barrage of fucking bicycles out front was absurd. I know its San Francisco, and for how much i fucking hate cyclists, i should really just stop going there. But that can't be avoided, so ill just continue to hate on any pedal powered object and fagwads who ride them.

Drinks are decent prices and theres good specials now and again...

Enjoy all it has to offer, just expect more hipsters than anyone ever needs in one place.  (more than zero)   

Coors original is available, so Thieves Tavern earns itself a mention based just off that.
author: Sam W.

description: Someone decided to only have two beer on tap and both Belgium. That's great but the duvel taste like duvel that was drinkable two months ago. And around there no one ever tasted a duvel. Awesome.
author: Nelson G.

description:
My first night in my new neighborhood bar totally made me feel at home.  I ran into my friend Misty here randomly right when I walked in so it felt typically San Francisco in a good way.  

The last time I was here it was still the Hush Hush so it had been a while but it remained low key and chill.  The jukebox is now digital, but otherwise it seemed pretty similar with the booths and pool tables.  

I challenged my friend Lara to a game of Donkey Kong.  On my first two men, I had a total of 100 points (?!) but rallied on the third man and completed the first two stages and got an extra man even.  I eventually died without making a high score, but my pocket is full of quarters right now which means....
author: Gene X.

description:
This was my go-to neighborhood place and man, I miss it. It was my first enjoyable whiskey experience. All the bartenders are super nice! When I didn't know what I wanted, they gave me tastings for free!  It was amazing. I found my favorite whiskey (Willett) and it's my preferred liquor of choice now. Thieves is amazing. 

Also, on another note... two of my relationships have started at thieves and one of my friend's too (after I recommended it to her). Not bad for discovering it only two years ago :)
author: Kara Y.

description:
Am I the only one that uses the photo booth here? I like sitting in it after I've had one too many and my lazy eye's come out to play. Seriously, I've taken so many atrocious pictures here that I swear will never see the light of day but my boyfriend insists on sticking to the refrigerator. 

Thieves has other things going for it though, like good whiskeys and cool bartenders. Great neighborhood bar.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Looking for a chill place to drink near 16th & Mission but not quite in that hustle bustle?  Thieves Tavern is the place to go.  Just a few minutes from the 16th St. BART stop, the bar had enough of a crowd to feel happening but wasn't so packed I felt trapped (I went on a Friday night).  The crowd is pretty hipster but we are talking about the Mission.

They appeared to only have three beers on tap but they were Anchor Porter, Chimay & Sierra Nevada so that wasn't too bad.  The rest of the bar was drinking tall PBRs, so more draughts for me!  My date and I both ordered Chimay but the keg was almost out.  The bartender poured about 90% of the second beer before it ran out but still only charged us for one beer!  Thanks!

Other highlights include: open seats at the bar, pool table & photo booth.
author: Liz H.

description:
Great Pub. As serendipity would have it, last week I poked my head in to have a pint of Anchor's Steam while I waited for some friends to arrive for our dinner reservation. The bartender was nice and welcoming and the prices were generous. I didn't get a chance to try their drink specials due to time constraints, but I'll definitely be back here with some friends.

The place has plenty to do when you're not drinking too. Pool tables, Galaga and comfy seating. The PBR was ever-present, as it should be in this area, and the selection of beers on tap were at par. Other people who've encountered this bar claim that it is night and day depending on which night you go, but I will return and reserve the final fifth star to see how it fares on a weekend night when it will undoubtedly be packed.
author: James T.

description:
Jessi is my new favorite bar tender! 

Have you noticed that there's a lot special nights or days at bars that involve meat?   Well at Thieves on Sunday's from noon to Five you can power up on the salad of all Bloody Mary's.  Jessi makes totally Vegan Bloody Mary's that really kick you in the ass, they are spicy!
She uses all kinds of toppings, which is the best, even pickled okra and beans, pepperoncinis, and of corse celery... she might switch it up on you who knows.  There's always a pita and hummus plater and think this weekend she's adding baby carrots to the dipping try.

Plus she always has a big smile to greet you with, which is a nice change.

As far as Thieves Tavern, it's a chill place, they have TV's and a digital Juke box.  There's  a pool table which is my favorite part.  The whiskey selection is awesome which is to be expected at  a thieves bar.  
Always cool patrons there as well.
author: amanda v.

description:
This is now my neighborhood bar, having recently moved just around the corner from it. Most nights, having it close by replaces the need for late night TV, because I get a kick out of observing the drunken shenanigans occurring outside it from my bedroom window.

It's your classic hipster/dive bar (one of the most popular drinks served being the ubiquitous tallboy PBR), but that doesn't necessarily mean it's come directly off the hipster/dive bar assembly line... It definitely has its own distinctive character. That's certainly helped by the bartenders and the care they take in keeping you happy and entertained.

The jukebox is fun... I'm always amazed at how often I get to hear something by The Knife there. That goes a long way in making any place feel like home to me.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
I wasn't expecting much when going here. It was a Sunday morning, dimly lit, not too many people inside. An imposing bartender greeted us.

Me: We need six bloody marys.
Barkeep: I make my bloody marys one way. Spicy. With bacon. And cheese. And tomatoes and lettuce. I make no substitutions. Do you want them?
Me: Yes.
Barkeep: That'll be 60$.

We paid, but then he offered us 5$ off if we chose a few songs from the jukebox. I took my five dollars and threw it in there - as soon as Rocket Man came on, the barkeep was our best friend. 

Those bloody marys were amazing. Possibly best I've had. I think he used barbecue sauce amongst many other ingredients, and he fried up fresh bacon to put on a skewer. Awesome. We were all in heaven.

To top it off, as we're drinking and enjoying the place (more people started showing up, btw) he comes over and asks if anyone wants free waffles! So he goes behind the bar and whips up some waffle batter and proceeds to make his guests waffles, with all the fixin's at the end of the bar. Pretty friggin' cool.

Overall, I had a really fun time here. Location and slight grimey feel to the place dock it a star, but I'll bet if I go a few more times and have similar experiences, I'd re-rate this place at 5 stars. It's a nice find.
author: Nick B.

description:
The bartender bought me a drink because he liked my jukebox selections.

This place is pretty sweet.
author: Anna G.

description:
Part of the Trio of whiskey bars and I have to say...the nicest. 

They have a nice bar, nice tables and pool tables!  I watched basketball on tv and the bartender was quick to serve and super chill. 

I got hit on by a super drunk dude which was more funny than flattering considering he was WASTED beyond belief. Still...what lady doesn't love the attention of the male persuasion? 

I dig it...need to roll out here way more often.
author: Jay H.

description: Stopped by looking for a dive bar for a few drinks and that's exactly what we got. Cool place with a solid jukebox. Came in during the day and it was basically empty, but the female bartender was cool and treated us well. They have some pool tables in the back and we ended up stopping in again at night, the place gets pretty hoppin'. If you're lookin for a cool dive bar in San Fran, this place fits the bill nicely.
author: Michael K.

description:
Pretty friggin' awesome local watering hole.  Bartenders are super friendly, drinks are reasonably priced and stiffly poured.  I've had the bartenders give me change to pick some music for the juke box (which has a wide variety of songs) - GIVE me change...not make change for me, by the way.

Now I'm not a huge whiskey or beer drinker, but they always have some kind of combo special for a good shot of the brown liquor and a PBR - $7, I believe.  Good stufff.  :)

Amenities: 2 pool tables, booth and bar seating, juke box, photo booth, 2 flat screens and a projector screen.

Very solid overall!!!!
author: Eric H.

description:
I just got back here from this bar.  It's on the corner of 14th St. and Guerrero St., not far from the big Safeway and Market St.  It has two pool tables and I wanted to play but my friends didn't seem to be in mood, just want to sit down and enjoy stiff drinks.

Basically, we came here for some alcohol and we did.  A friend got us Pabst beers and I hadn't drank that for a long time.  Looks like it's back in the picture.  The taste was alright, just another piss beer.  Then, we had some stiff drinks and apparently, they are into whiskeys now and we had the rye whiskey one, forgot which brand.  The taste was much stronger, sipped slowly down our throats and it was a smooth one.  So, we chilled and used sign language to talk (we are deaf).

We talked about lots of things like how one friend likes being a daddy.  He's got a one year old son.  They talked about motorcycles as they had one themselves and were discussing on a route up hwy 1. Mostly, I listened and also watched the Giants game on TV, lincoeum was pitching and they won it 3 to 1 over N.Y Mets.  

Whiskeys were $7 each,  beers $4.  Cash only.  Service was friendly and bartenders know how to say thank you in sign language.

Will come here again and play some pool!
author: Nathan K.

description:
This place is actually more divey than the typical Mission bar (maybe due to the location at the outskirts close to the under-freeway section).  Pretty empty for Friday happy hour.  Loud music.  Lots of loud 80's music (thanks  Ed to the M!).  

Made it pretty hard to hear anyone other than your neighbors although I did get the riff about Final Countdown in person and I see your Europe and raise you Asia, Heat of the Moment! (yeah, I had to look that up on wikipedia).  

Maybe because I'm on these 80's theme but the place is like an 80's bar.  Bare.  Dark.  Dark paint.  Dark lighting.  Bartender wearing dark tshirt like a biker chick.

Anyways, go and enjoy the music Ed to the M downloaded for all patrons!

Bike Parking: designated bike racks in front.
author: Jean K.

description: Favorite sf bar. Two pool tables, 5 booths, and awesome atmosphere. Bartenders are rad.  During the weekend craze this bar stands out for you never feel like it is to packed you can't walk.
author: Cristina U.

description:
Yup, it is a dive bar! 

2 pool tables.

This place is like a College Bar for 30's Something Hipster Wannabees! 

If that is your sweet spot, you'll like it here!

Skinny Jeans are optional.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
J you classy muthfucka you!  How could I ever complain about the debauchery art you create, and the gorgeous mixtress Pilar adding to all the intoxicating moments we all live for here!!  I gladly walked in around 4ish and didn't leave till 9ish ya that's right.  "I was happy in the haze of a drunken hour, But heaven knows I'm miserable now" - The Smiths .....

Anyway quit being a square and get your pansy ass over here, and suck a stiff one............and stumble happily home.
author: Eryka V.

description:
Love that this place can pretty much be anything you want it to be.

Super chill whiskey + cheap beer bar? Yup.
Cozy little tables with cute lighting? Sure.
Crazy schwasted barflies trying to pick up anyone/thing in sight? Definitely.
Insta dance party in the back to the rockin jukebox? Oh yeah.

Seriously, their jukebox is out of control.
author: Monica C.

description:
The best part about this place is the pricing for drinks.  The seasonal beer on tap is $4 a pint, and PBR tallboys are $3, how awesome is that for San Francisco??

The seating at the front feels a bit crowded, and the bathrooms are pretty clean.  The back of the bar has a couple pool tables, and is well lit - easy place to relax, grab a bar stool, have a few drinks, and catch up with a friend.
author: Tran C.

description:
Aside from a group of great people that I met up with here on a fine Saturday afternoon, what is Thieves Tavern all about ??

I had heard legends about Pilar's guest bartending stint on the last Saturday of every month. ( If you don't know who Pilar is, betta ax somebody!) 

I started with a Corona but like Will Haven " I've seen my fate". That fate was one of Pilar's BLT Bloody Marys. At first sip, I wasn't captivated. A quick stir and second sip later, I was indeed sucked into the vortex. 

" You never been on a ride like dis befo' " 

I went back to beers, as Mary was really rough but treated me right. 

A couple games of pool, a round or two of the arcade classic " Burgertime" , while a bride was having pictures taken while she played Ms.Pac Man, or Galaga. (Yes, a bride really was here.)

Morrissey blasted through the speakers as the Drunk Lover entered, shots of Cabo Wabo were poured for my French doppleganger and I. 

A fun little bar blocks removed from Hipster Academy. 

Scream at it.
author: Taj A.

description:
Mmm, bacon salad...in my bloody mary...on a sunny weekend afternoon...*drool*

So, yeah, that's really about all you need to know about this place.  I don't know that it's every Saturday that they do this, but they will when kick-ass guest bartenders are serving.  Bacon and cherry tomatoes on a skewer, smeared with cream cheese and wrapped in a romaine lettuce leaf as a garnish for the bloody mary, which itself is substantial, spicy and delicious. 

Sure, the other drinks are made with a heavy pour, there's a jukebox and a pool table, and there's sometimes free food on weekend afternoons.  Bartenders (guests or regulars) are awesome and friendly.  The co-ed bathrooms are dark and a little dingy but otherwise very clean.  A great Mission bar adjacent to the Castro. But, really, the bacon bloody marys are where it's at.

Mmm, liquid brunch...*drool*
author: Sus... B.

description: This is just a quality local spot for reasonable drinks and a good time. Like one other poster said I wouldn't call it a dive per se, it's more of a neighborhood bar type place. On Sundays during NFL they have $6 bacon bloodies that are delicious and potent -- highly recommended. And if you are a Baltimore Ravens fan there is a small but strong contingent that heads there every Sunday.
author: Tbone M.

description:
Pretty fun place, especially if you're into whiskey.  

Don't know what you like, not a problem, the bartender will let you sample before you commit.  

Prices are pretty good and the pours are definitely on the heavy-handed side.  

They have TVs and a couple of pool tables.  You don't need much more than that at a bar.
author: jenn c.

description:
You know what's even better than a bar with decent pool tables, good music, and a killer whiskey selection?

That bar, with the lovely Miss Pilar standing behind it.

... I really don't think I need to say anything more.
author: Elle Q.

description: One of their bartenders is excellent at scaring customers away. Next time, when someone asks you to put a game on and you're not going to change the channel, try responding in a less condescending tone (especially after a different bartender said it would be on). No way they'll get my business again!
author: Katie S.

description: This is a great whiskey bar imo. On a weekly basis, my friend and I do what I call whiskey school. We used to just pick a bar, and find a good valued whiskey for ourselves to enjoy. We found a lot of glitze and glamour and even a lot of poor selections. Then we came across Thieves Tavern. Bar tender was really chill and even entertained our little game of school. She grabbed a bottle from the back and asked each of us for 5 dollars. It was pretty good with a rough finish but overall a great value (Old Overholt). The upfront honesty was awesome. She said for 5 bucks you can't beat that. It also helped that they had a large and good selection of other whiskies as well. One of my fave whiskey bars in the city. On a weekday evening this place is awesome. It can get crowded on the weekends.
author: Greg G.

description:
What is the key to real estate?
Location, location, location. 

What is the key to a bar?
Customer service, customer service, customer service.....also great signature drinks. 

In a city full of bars/clubs/restaurants, there are plenty of places to grab a drink. Thieves Tavern is NOT one of those places. At Thieves, you SAVOR a drink, you let it slowly evaporate on your tongue. You watch a game on one of the huge wide screen TV's. You play pool on the two pool tables. What you don't do is slam a shot and leave. Well technically you can buy a shot, slam it and go, but it would be a shame. 

So today was the first Pilar-a-paluza. Despite the fact that there was only Pilar and 7 dudes, it was entertaining to say the least. I have never liked Bloody Mary's...never. But this place makes an excellent one. No need for breakfast as theirs comes w/ lettuce, cherry tomatoes, bacon, cream cheese, and green beans. It was delicious. 

They also have Irish coffees there. The bartender made one today that had eggnog instead of Bailey's. Again another excellent drink. He was personable, totally accommodating and friendly. There is but one thing on my wish list for Thieves Tavern....start accepting plastic. I will definitely go back to this awesome bar soon.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Things I love about this place: 
They have Anchor Steam seasonal beers on tap! Cool bartenders. And Queso and chips on Wednesday (homemade, er, barmade and the bar tender will totally talk about cheese for like 10 minutes... loves me some cheese!). 

Things I don't love:
Sometimes on Sat nights there is a strange crowd of like second match.com dates. I also wish they had an old school jukebox instead of online, but that is just my pref.

Good place. Try it.
author: Kate M.

description:
I don't love it.. I live around the corner, been here for 5 years AND only been once to Thieves Tavern.. that's enough!

I love dives, I'll stick to Dalva.
author: Monica S.

description:
Rolling into Thieves Tavern with the now infamous Pilar is much akin to strolling into a Las Vegas night club with Barry Manilow or having box seats at the Kentucky Derby with Hugh Hefner.    

Men wanted to be me and women wanted to be with me. 

Not far from my house sits this new little corner of my universe where lounge style seats and 4 dollar well drinks will be used and abused for many days to come.   

My only suggestion is that the owners invest in a velvet rope and a VIP table for Pilar because she is rumored to be coming out with her new designer scent called "Phenomenal" and she may need a place for a release party. Just sayin.
author: Dru P.

description:
I'd never been here before this Sunday, but I'm really grateful for the introduction. Why?

1. BLT Bloody Mary.

2. Free waffles

3. Delicious *special* whipped cream for said waffles.

All were delightfully consumed by yours truly from the comfort of a cushy booth. I hope to partake of their tasty goodness again soon!
author: Madeleine K.

description:
I'm a fan. Cheap, strong drinks. Friendly people. Just stop running out of cranberry and we'll give you 5/5. 

I even love that Dorothy Darling hangs out with the youngin's, schooling us on how to drink gin and carrot juice. (wtf?)
author: Brenda C.

description:
Everything about this place is super cool because of the staff and the patrons.  My friend and I were filming a music video and needed a bar to film at.  Since my friend lives around the corner, he asked the staff if we could film there and they right away said sure, no problem.  A blessing!  It was a Sunday afternoon...and their bloody mary's are awesome.  Nobody even really paid attention to what we were doing, everyone just minded their own business and enjoyed their own experience at the bar.  We asked a few people to be in the shoot and they were like, sure.  Thank you very much Thieves Tavern.  I have been meaning to write this for a long time.  Please enjoy the music video called CRUMBS you are in.
http://www.youtube.com/user/Leorawrites#p/u/4/Ntv9-nBQcWQ
and also the bonus footage. http://www.youtube.com/user/Leorawrites#p/u/3/D0gdKIPg8EQ
author: The Deed W.

description: This is a small neighborhood bar.  Just so, some nights it seems dead, others its busy and much more fun.  I like the low ceilings and the low light.  The atmosphere make me want to hang.
author: Patrick B.

description:
I love that the bartender was passionate about Whiskey. Everyone here loves to drink PBR, which I was told was the "hit" of the bar.

But if you look around on the walls this place has a ton of variety and my friends and I went with Whisky/Bourbon/Rye and just loved it. The Bartender was happy to have us drinking the good stuff (aka not PBR), and just joined in the fun with us which was awesome.

I now know more and appreciate whiskey than I ever had because of this place
author: Eric A.

description:
Must go if you are a whiskey/bourbon aficionado. Kronenbourg on tap. 

Two pool tables; where else are you going to get that? Jillians? I'd rather be mauled by a pack of wolverines.

And if you are worried about roving packs of *insert cultural phenotype with snide adjective and snarky descriptions of clothing and transportation choices* then yes, those will be there! And so will I, if you want to play a game of pool.
author: Alex W.

description: One of my favorite places to go to on a Saturday night. Every experience I've had here is awesome. Good music, good crowd, and good booze. Cash only, but that's no big deal.
author: Joe J.

description: Solid dive bar with pool table, jukebox, and best happy hour specials of PBR and shot of Jameson. This is a local staple with great barkeep.
author: Cody H.

description: Overcharged my friend, slow service, took away a half full drink. They eventually rectified the overcharged bill which halted service (took two people to sort out) and offered to replace the discarded drink but that was too little too late. Not a good time at all.
author: Patrick S.

description:
You know how I said that great customer service goes a long way in my book?

The owner of Thieves took the time to contact me after I wrote my review, apologized and explained the whole smoke issue, and offered me some drinks to compensate the next time I come back.  

Customer service WIN for sure!
author: Alice C.

description: I really like this place for everything it wasn't. It wasn't too loud. It wasn't too busy. It's neighborhoody and a little off the beaten path, which is a good thing. And, I didn't feel like I was old. I didn't drink and nobody cared. I loved the amateur art on the walls and the pool tables in the back. Overall, I look forward to returning.
author: Andrew K.

description:
So, most of the time these days, I try to avoid the Mission.  Parking sucks, I'm starting to feel older than every person who walks past me, and I find that each time in breathe in, I smell urine everywhere.  So, when a friend was having a going-away party and wanted to meet in the Mission, I sucked it up, buttoned my lip so I wouldn't complain, and headed on over.
After starting at a not-to-be-named trendy bike hang-out, we wandered over here when it got chilly.  I had never been here before and, upon walking in, was immediately at home.  It was a chill atmosphere, with good music and a pool table.  Really, what more could you want?  In addition, the drinks were affordable and the bathroom was CLEAN!  I was in dive-bar heaven.  To top it all off, they were cool with us bringing in pizzas and hanging out for hours.  It rocked.  I suppose the Mission's not so bad after all...
author: Jessica L.

description:
The manager is amazingly cool, he's remembered my because my wife and I used to end up there because it was just around the corner from our house. 

I loved it when it was quieter, honestly, but the last thing I want is for Thieves to go away. Whatever it takes, it's a great bar, great staff, great booze.
author: Chad G.

description: space's OK, crowd is on the young and fratty side. cocktails were nothing spectacular. not really getting the hype about this place.
author: Ruben K.

description:
I have always loved this place. In the past saw a few great bands here. 

Jay used to make the BEST Bloodymarys I have ever had! :( Now he's living in Brazil. Dam, I guess I'm going to have to go to Brazil for the worlds best bloodymary. He used to also make waffles. I'll have to go back and see if anyone picked up where he left off.
author: Cari G.

description:
From the outside, and the neighborhood, you'd think it's a dive.  You'd expect a dive.  And you'd be right to.

You'd be wrong.

Dive bars don't have 125 different whiskeys.  Yeah.  125.  For reals.  About half of those are bourbon, and the other half are divided between Scotch and Irish.  The prices are pretty reasonable too, especially for such a large selection.
(BTW - if you like bourbon, you have to try the Willett's - they have 2 different bottles, and that shit is fantastic.  Incredibly rich, fruity flavor and aroma, and unbelievably smooth considering it's 121 proof.)

Good beer on tap too - including Chimay, 1664, and everything Anchor makes.

There's a projector running tv or movies, the obligatory pool tables, and a classic Donkey Kong.  Sweet.
author: Don H.

description: the bartenders here are just great.  really fucking great.  so are the cocktails.  and if you find yourself here or near on a saturday, pop in for the blt bloody mary and free waffles.
author: Emily T.

description:
My friends and I decided not to kid ourselves this NYE.  No pretentious bars with pricey watered down drinks or clubs with $40 cover charges, especially not after the way 2009 kicked our asses.  No fancy Wizard of Oz facade for us, just a bottle of Andre and dive bars. Yeah, keepin' it classy.

We stopped by 500 Club briefly and weren't feelin' it so we headed over to Thieves, where a friend told us that they were handing out free beers until 11:30 and a free shot of Jameson at midnight.  We ran over with alcohol-lust and surprisingly, we actually found an empty booth where we could hear each other without having to strain our voices.  The bartenders were friendly, the crowd was probably only 10% hipsters, and Journey was on the jukebox.  Could you really ask for anything more?

Thanks for the drinks and letting my stingy Asianness go undetected last night!

Happy New Year, Yelpers!
author: Jen L.

description:
Alright, so I'm not usually a chain lurvin' kind of gal but I have to say Thieves is pretty cool. I wandered into Whiskey Thieves on a very dirty night, and last night wandering into this Thieves was no different. 

Hot door guy? Check. Cool bartender who bought my friend and I a round AND made wearing overalls look awesome? Check. Laid back clientele? Check. Just the right amount of people to make it comfortably crowded, not annoyingly packed? Check.

If you are lookin' for a place to chill with your best friend that you met in NYC (but now lives in SF) over a special of PBR and a shot of whiskey (man I love that special), then you have found it my friend. Grab a stool at the bar and catch up over a stupid amount of vodka sodas or pints of Kronenbourg 1664. Get your bar fitness on by challenging some dudes (or dudettes) to a game of pool.
