Beg a really cute girl to make you some super sweet dream catcher earrings that she makes for fun. (Plum please--holla!) Watch a super HEATED tennis match at the bar while some dude in a lime green polo (sorry) and his nice friend (hi!) wonder OUT LOUD what that bandage is on your wrist. (Dude, it's a fresh tattoo. I'm not a cutter! AND I can hear you!)

Ahem.

I have to say I'm a fan. Maybe not of the dude in the green, but his friend, my friend, her friends, the overalls sportin' bartender, the hot door dude (well hi!), and the vodker soders. You guys are alright with me.
author: Melody L.

description:
Keane L: Grey Goose martini please.
Bartender: Makers' Mark neat.
Keane L.: No, no... Grey Goose martini...
Bartender: oh... sorry..
Keane L.: but I'll take that too....

Why do I do this??! 

Anyway, I was honored by the presence of a great number of fine, sexy Yelpers. Bar was decent. No wait. Fun jukebox. Lots of seating. My only gripe is that this place doesn't take credit, and their ATM machine was busted. 

But here's the big news. Are you ready? 

I got kicked out of the bar.

Yes, me. Keane L. Me, the nice guy that compliments you all the damn time. He tried to kick me out. Why? Because I had a bottle of Tanq that I bought down the street. Doesn't he know I'm Chinese?! We're cost-effective sons of bitches. Now, some anonymous Yelper has my Tanq bottle. Well, at least they let me back in, thanks to Sav B., Matt H., Pookie W., and my brother Gabriel T.

Live and learn. That's how I roll.
author: Keane L.

description:
New to the neighborhood, I'm proud to call this dive a new weekday and even weekend preferred haunt.  Why do we call it Dirty Girls again?  Why did I take that shot of tequila at 1:55am that one night there? Eek!

The jukebox is never too full to get a song played (except for that one time when that guy played the entire In Rainbows CD 1.5 times! Way to go!) and they luckily serve PBR in a bottle.  So after work, mid afternoon, or even right after the gym, a quick $3 beer won't set you back.  The bartenders are really, really nice and there is plenty of sitting, standing and pool-playing room.  Close enough for me to stumble home from and close enough to stumble back into the mission.
author: Nicole d.

description:
I sure do miss sunday funday here.
Haven't been for a long time and i don't dare, it just wouldn't be the same thing.
But i will however advice you to pay it a visit.

I mostly gave it four stars because Justin was working and i hung out with sunny funny people here a while ago.
author: cecilia k.

description:
At the eleventh bar of Christmas I bought myself for me:
One vodka Red Bull
One Fernet
One vodka Red Bull
One PBR
One Fernet
One PBR
One PBR
One Jack and Coke
One PBR
One vodka Red Bull
One pint of PBR
This place opened up a couple years ago and has always rocked.
Small bar with two pool tables featured with the booths that run parallel to the bar.
Not much elbow room here, but whatever - it's always a great time.
Room enough to do The Worm (yeah I was pretty tossed)
http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-worm-san-francisco#hrid:Gx_zqxDqwgraQV-xcKRoaw
To boot, perhaps the most genuinely nice bartenders in the city work here.
They'll talk about anything with anyone, not just the pretty people.
I like that a lot.
author: Theo R.

description:
It must be a pant load when your neighborhood bar up and moves out of your neighborhood. On one hand, The Hush-Hush, a bar you couldn't pay me to miss is gone. On the other, the original Thieves, once a neighborhood beer & wine bar deeper in The Mission, beloved by its regulars and now  occupying the space that the Hush-Hush once stunk up. With a full monty liquor license. More liquor, more problems.

Good bartenders. Even a pretty nice doorman. He kicked some guy out for being a little too, "Hey, I want to own a home one day so I'm doing a little sneaky Pete". Then he let "The Guy" back in. Hence, he's one pretty nice bouncer. Internet jukebox. "Come as you are" johns (which is which? fuggit!). Dark, sexy lighting. Good Fellas booths. No draft cider, but Kronenbourg 1664 on tap. They brag about how their beer is made with "the caviar of hops". Ugh. That said, a tasty Stella surrogate.

Too Much Drunky Business:

Nothing will ever diminish how fine a song Oh L'Amour by Erasure is. Or its gayness. Not time, fate or act of god. That fantastic song has taken poops that are gayer than you. Ed M. & Maria D., we really showed them, you two beautiful huckleberries...

Kelly H., next time we hang and you introduce me to nice hot ladies, try and make me sound cooler than "This is Jeremy. He's incredibly knowledgeable about lots of random facts!". Girl, that line is(n't) a total panty-dropper. I'm not telling you to lie. But lie.

I forgot how a Mission bar on weekend night can really get my Roofie-Sense tingling. It's like I have Douchebag Lizard Radar or something. Towards the end of the night I was as nervous as a one-legged man at an ass-kicking contest. I see real potential for Thieves to become a neighborhood bar in its own right and hopefully that will take care of the unctuous, B&T, hair gel fest that kicked off around 12:15. Note that I'm attacking the issue, not the bar. 

Heidi A., you mystical Drink Faerie in Prince's Dirty Mind raincoat. If you ever dare to leave me, I'm going to your window with a boombox and a two-sided cassingle of The Men All Pause. 

There is an empty, yawning chasm that sits in an Omid-less, STORMI-less Yelp happy Hour. No one wants to talk about it, no one gets less drunk, but there's just something missing. And I feel so objective for not deducting Stars on this point alone.  

Drue C., did your shirt get ripped MORE? If so, crap. Meaning, I left, as ever, too early yet not soon enough. Of course I was very, very drunk.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
There is something about Thieving which appeals to us at a very deep level. In our childhood, we are fascinated by fables like Ali Baba and Forty Thievies while in our adulthood, we swing in an ecstasy induced trance to the music of Thievery Corporation. So what was Hush Hush till now has now been revealed as a watering hole for Thievies.

When DYL is held at bars like 111 Minna or Ambassador, yelpers have to adjust to the norms and culture of the Bar, or in Darwinian terms, we need to adapt ourselves to these places. Whereas, in a place like Thievies Tavern, DYL walks in and takes over the Bar, making them adapt to us.

The drinks are reasonable, the bartenders friendly. The two pool tables, the good layout, the external proximity to Mission and Castro, they all score positive points for this Bar. There were lot of new yelpers(welcome-o) sprinkled with familiar faces. People were just having a good time. 

If I were to rate this Bar on the basis of "how much fun I had and suitability for DYL" it would be 5 stars. However, if I were not part of DYL(scary thought), it would be 3 stars. Since I am in a generous mood, I am averaging my ratings and giving it 4 stars.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
Recipe for how not to run a trivia contest:

1. Use esoteric, puzzle-type questions like word scrambles and hard arithmetic problems that almost nobody gets right.

2. For a host, utilize a milquetoast, Ryan Seacrest wannabe jackass who berates everyone for not being quiet when he's talking.

3. Give him some sort of a Fisher Price P.A. system so that nobody can hear a word he says anyway.

Also, dear fellow yelpers, this is not "a Mission dive bar" -- besides the fact that 14th and Guerrero is hardly the heart of the Mission, dive bars aren't clean and decorated, and they don't have two full-sized pool tables, trivia nights, arcade games, and a gazillion upscale whiskeys!
author: Adam Z.

description:
Its been a while since I have had my shirt bitten at a bar by a sexy chick, and then ripped off Chippendale style by the same hot woman. Oh, wait, that has never happened to me before (note to self: Me A is not as innocent as she looks). 

I am trying to recall the last time my ass was grabbed by so many different people in one evening. I can't remember ever hearing so much drunk wailing in a non-karaoke setting. 

I know the beer was reasonably priced ($3 for an Anchor), but, though I had at least 4 shots (good pours), several beers and a few mixed drinks (a bit on the weak side - blessing in disguise) I cant speak to the prices of the rest of the drinks. HUGE thank you to all of my fellow yelpers who bought my unemployed ass a drink last night.....far too many to mention, but you know who you are and I really appreciate the contribution to my hangover.

Cool little spot with 2 pool tables, a digital jukebox and some comfy booths to sit in. I wouldn't make a special trip but I would definitely stop back in if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Drue C.

description:
I won't dance in a club like this
All the girls are slags
and the beer tastes just like piss 

(reference: http://www.thespecials.com/history.php)
author: Maria D.

description:
I don't think my panda shirt has ever had so much loving. Even the creepy pizza slinger with the jagged teeth down on Mission gave it a nod. A disturbing, head-scratching nod, but still, my pandy got mad attention

Jagged toothed pizza-slinger: "We should get that shirt for our friend"
Drunk Yelper who eats more pizza than you: "Oh your friend likes pandas?"
JTPS: "No, she's obsessed with panda sex"
DYWEMPTY:.............

Ok, back to Thieves Tavern. Matt H. is the master of flattery, and told my panda all night, how nice she was...paired with the classy remark "wow, you have really big breasts. How come women wear these shirts where the picture or logo is right on their breast, then question us for staring at them?"

Enough about the panda, unless you'd like to talk about it further. No? It eats bamboo and is freakishly cute. Ok, I'm obnoxious

I really enjoyed this bar at first. Really chill atmosphere, nice seating areas, high tech jukebox, pool tables, super sweet chica bartender. 

After about, oh, who am I kidding, I don't count how many drinks I've had! I'm so not that responsible. So I'm wasted and I forget that I haven't eaten, so Karen K. and I hop over to some pizza joint on Mission, where I inhale food like I've been living in the Cambodian jungle for 19 years. After I eat and return to Thieves Tavern, I realize I'm completely sober.

I don't know that many Yelpers, I'm back to my awkward sober self, and I'm watching a guy I've exchanged maybe two words with ("Sammy S" were those two words) getting screamed out of the bar by a bouncer with far too much red on. After that, the vibe seemed to shift, and I was all of a sudden totally over the place. 

I sat, drank water and talked to Sav B. (not sure if he even remembers) about drugs until my non-Yelp friends came and whisked me away to my bed.....wait no, I mean my floor. Ya, I'm that friend. You non-Yelpers better appreciate how comfy my bed is, because the floor, not so much.
author: Sammy S.

description:
This past Saturday, my original plans to host a friend visiting from out of town fell by the way side when he was called in to work. Lounging lazily on my bed, trying to finish the newest novel in time for book club this week, I perked up when my phone rang. On the other end, a gentleman I had just recently met was inquiring if I had plans that evening. He had done his research on my favorite type of drinking environments and quickly suggested Theives Tavern. Having never been there, I checked it out on Yelp and was pleased with its divey reputation and even more so with the name. I pictured an oldy-time wooden bar full of pirates and sailors and once inside, I realized my imagination wasn't far off!

This place is cool...I like the cozy booths running the wall and the long straight wooden bar. Any place that offers a shot of whiskey with a PBR as their special for that night usually wins my affection pretty quickly (Benders, you're next on my review list). We ordered up our "specials" and scored a pool table. Immediately, a friendly gal asked if we wanted to play partners. We agreed and while the boys racked 'em and chatted, she dragged me to the juke box which still had 6 credits to go. "Come on girl, make me proud." she said and walked away. I popped in some Stones, Guns and Roses, Al Green, Prince, Marvin Gaye and Ray Charles. Your usual pub style playlist, and I was rewarded by random cheers from the booths each time a new song came on.

We played pool, had cheap drinks and listened to good music. It wasn't crowded and I never had to wait in line for the ladies room. Also, as the name implies, it's a great place to hide out. Anywhere I can maintain a certain level of anonymity is ok by me. See you again soon Theives Tavern
author: Lynsey C.

description: Have a great time here every time I come! but watch out people here can be too worried about their "image" they don't enjoy it when your dancing and singing along too your favorite jam off the jukebox. Besides that the drink are cheap and the pool tables slant too the left!!!
author: Jimmy S.

description:
I spent 4+ hours at Thieves tonight -  my first time - and sat in the same seat at the bar with a friend and had exceptional personal service.

Oliver is my new favorite bartender. Thieves sells a great selection of whisky ... which I like to drink. Ask to try something and he'll serve up a little taste, with a smile and perhaps a jig or a joke.
author: A S.

description:
Your average bar with a juke box, a couple pool tables and a pinball machine. Ultimately, it's the company that makes or breaks this place. If you're looking for a laid-back environment that's not so loud that you have to scream at each other to talk, this is a good option. I little on the "dive bar" side with a somewhat aggro bartender (very large tattooed man) who takes life way too serious. The owner was nice and the first bartender, a tall brunette woman, was a delight to work with. This place never got too packed that you couldn't move around pretty freely which is great. 

3.5 stars
author: Gabriel R.

description:
I've been going to Thieves for a few years now, and it's one of my favorite places in the city. It has a really laid back vibe, due to the awesome environment (comfy booths, great art), and the bartenders are all absolutely top-notch- friendly, knowledgeable, and cool as hell. 

I never fail to have a good time there- highly recommended.
author: Adrian H.

description:
Hooray for the bar that is closest to my apartment!

But seriously, in an area full of good dive bars, Thieves stands out, well, as a great dive bar.

Sure, it doesn't have the ambiance of a Dalva or Delerium, but it doesn't have the crowds either.  And its got 2 pool tables, and that makes it better than 500 club for that.

And now I am totally making this review sound like a Hyundai ad, by picking specific features of the rivals that they are better than, and implying they are better than all these places in total.

Well, OK, maybe not, but the bar staff is friendly and they'll let you try anything.  So this place is not quite the magic that is Whiskey Thieves, but it is, you know. AROUND THE CORNER FROM MY APARTMENT.

I don't even miss the Hush Hush
author: Steve S.

description: Stopped in here for an after work drink with my sister. Great feeling to the bar. Not overly crowded, good vibe, nice bartender and great selection. They have a huge variety of single malt scotch and have the entire Anchor Steam line on tap. I wasn't there for any of the free food being discussed in other reviews. But they were showing every sporting event that customers wanted and it was fun to just hang out and talk or join into the games.
author: Ben B.

description:
What a great neighborhood bar!  

Its a lovely place to watch the afternoon turn slowly into the evening, as you consume random drinks the bartenders are creating.  

Its got that sufficiently-dark-dive-bar thing, but is always nice and tidy.

No credit cards, but they have an ATM.
author: Stephan W.

description:
Fuck the reviews(just kidding)my review means most!  If you play pool(which I don't) this place (RIGHT NOW) is crackin.(crackin?) yes, cracking (why?) Because for one, this spot probably has the newest pool tables in the City... it use to be the hush hush and I liked the dancing when it was the hush hush but no dancing now... no more secrets!  I only show up on Tuesdays (so what if I'm bias) when my Folks are working... I love the pinball games!  - a  star, why?  I continue to miss the crowd!  The jukebox looks like an atm.  Do I care? NO! It's the most understanding juke box that I know.  Even sorts by name ;0)

If you are 100% negro.... ummm... not your crowd~
Everyone else- come with somebody because it's new!!
author: Jamal G.

description:
Typical Mission dive bar.  I met some friends here last night and my first impression was "dude bar."  I saw all the signs: hot lady bartender, flat screen tvs playing various sports, and two pool tables.   It was not too crowded for a Thursday night and we were easily able to get seats at a booth.  Thieves Tavern is also quiet/conducive to good conversations.  Nothing stood out or was overly special, but it's a nice neighborhood joint to kick back at.

I got a little confused though b/c there is that other bar in the Mish at 24th/Treat called Dirty Thieves.  That one is a dude bar too.

So many darned thieves around!!
author: Sid D.

description:
My obligatory $.02 on Thieves Tavern:

Decent space with moderate drink prices, nice bartenders, and comfortable loungey areas, which are too close to the bar.

The Jukebox is a nice touch, but really, there is nothing that makes this place stand out from the myriad other bars in the Mission.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Unfortunately this place lives up to it's name: collectively our group had a purse, hoodie and a coat stolen yesterday eve. 

Of course, it's doubtful the establishment itself had anything to do with this thievery, but I shall decree it only two stars for putting the idea out in the universe and beckoning would-be purse snatchers the world around. (One extra star for the rad tables and booths.)

I hereby decry: hold on to your belongings in this tavern for thieves!!



ps. turn the g-d damned music up.
author: petals o.

description:
I used to live across the street, and had to listen to all of the drunkards yelling and cavorting outside while they smoked. I didn't mind so much when it was the Hush Hush and the chattering smokers were cute dykes and bike riders. in fact I LOVED the Hush Hush. The people were nicer, they had a fun mix tape dance night, a rad mural on the wall, and even a 25 cent PBR night.

The day the Hush Hush turned into Thieves Tavern, it became a lame joint with a frat vibe. It was quite possibly, the day the music died.
author: ayahthetiger ..

description:
rad bar.  good luck finding a seat when it's packed.
rad staff, good tunes, off the valencia path and across from mission beach cafe - which comes in handy when you've been drinking at thieves on a sunday morning. 

PS - get the bloody mary.  it's got cream cheese and a piece of bacon in it, for crying out loud.
author: Carmel U.

description: I LOVE pizza! I've never had bad pizza! But this is good! Great locations. Ethernet good bars! Mmmmmmm
author: Ashley S.

description:
There we were, me and Donkey, two of the slightly more controversial characters on Yelp Talk, contemplating ways to further torture members on the boards with advanced trolling technique theory.  Cleverly disgused as a conversation among peers, little did the other drunken Yelpers know what was in store for the near future...muahhahahah..

Oh, hmm I may have said too much up there.

In any case, this was a lovely charming neighborhood bar that I would be proud to have near my place of residence.  As it stands though it was also a nice place to meet new Yelpers (i.e., those that I personally have not met) as well as regroup with ones of the past.

Well priced drinks, pool tables, somewhat spacious, and plenty of booths everywhere, not much more you can ask for out of a mini-dive.  

Booths boobs and booze always make for a winning combo.
author: Tien N.

description:
This is such a nice neighborhood bar far enough from the mess that is the mission sometimes but still down in it. The patrons, bartenders and owner are friendly and glad you are there. Fully stocked bar for all your craziest concoctions and pbr in a can or a bottle. Pool tables, comfy booths and there is space enough to turn it on or hunker down and have a conversation. 

This place is good for decent sized groups, couples and if you just want to get a pop solo.
author: William R.

description: Nothing like this dark neighborhood tavern to relax, throw back a few cold ones, and talk to a friendly crowd. They also have 2 pool tables and a scrabble board if your the type that needs stimulated while you drink. Jay and Oliver are by far the best duo bartenders, but the rest of the crew will also keep you smiling. I definitely recommend Thieves Tavern as well as their sister bars, Whiskey Thieves and Dirty Thieves.
author: Sarah J.

description:
The drink specials at Thieves Tavern are dangerous:  Saturday evening I stopped by and enjoyed several rounds of the whiskey & PBR special.  Sunday morning I awoke to find an angry tribe of howler monkeys ferociously beating on the walls of my head.  It is safe to say that this is no coincidence.  

Pretty divey here - but I like that about this place.  Plus, it tends to be a little less crowded than other nearby bars.
author: Matthew H.

description:
The staff is awesome both very friendly but not so hip that they don't forget what their job is. It's very clean but still has that nice divey atmosphere that we all love. 

The draft beer selection is not great - but hey the free toasted cheeses's make up for it (if you're nice;-). 

If you love good Scotch, Burbon, rye etc this is your place - they have a big selection
author: Him S.

description:
finally checked this place and pilar's bartending skillz out, and was not disappointed. i made it easy for her by just sticking with PBR, but she did a great job all day. dru was cookin up some bomb-ass pancakes, peeps were watching the elite 8 games, and we were getting ready for the pool tournament. 

the basketball games brought out a rowdy crowd, but they were a fun bunch. the pool tourney was fun, but i lost in typical andy t fashion, by sinking the 8 ball while scratching subsequently. 

overall a fantastic, warm saturday afternoon in the mish.
author: Andrew T.

description: Lovingly nicknamed Dirty Girls by my pals (who can remember why?), Thieves has got everything you could ask for in a neighborhood bar: cheap drinks, big booths, cool bartenders, a stellar whiskey selection, a jukebox, and pool tables... plus, it's not packed full of rowdy douchebags like the rest of the Mission bars as of late - let's keep it that way.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
there's nothing more comforting in walking into an unfamiliar bar than to be greeted by a hot bartender (hi pilar!) and friendly patrons.  you also can't beat tommy's southern hospitality, who i insisted call me 'miss' instead of 'ma'am.'  i'm not THAT old yet, i reckon.

'is it a bad idea to mix anchor steam ($3) w/robitussin?'  i posed this question to jane, a gal that i met that early evening.  we both deemed that i'd be fine, and i proceeded to conduct a brief show and tell of the rad earrings that i bought that day from noisepop's pop n shop.

the two pool tables ($1 games) in the back are situated perfectly.  the side that's closest to the wall is quite manageable to shoot w/o having to use a severe angle or use a short cue.  although i was able to find a 19 oz, the selection of cues can leave heavy-cue-pool-goers desperately wanting. 

friends and i were able to play quite a few games w/o being interrupted by hungry players wanting to get a game in.  thieves tavern has become one of my preferred divey spots to partake in a couple of beers and games of pool.
author: Ting A.

description: Pilar's made to order bloody mary paired with a skewer of cherry tomato, cream cheese and bacon wrapped in some lettuce. Need I say more?
author: Chum L.

description:
Red Breast, that's +4...

Hella hot asian chick (sorry never got your name, lol), that's +1... 

5 stars... ayn will be back...
author: Andrew N.

description:
Thieves is where you go when you already have your friends together and want to grab a booth and drink your drinks and shoot your shit and maybe also shoot some pool.

It's taken me awhile to write a review of this place cause I kinda want to keep it to myself and judging from the other reviews I'm not alone in that regard.

So, umm...there's a toilet monster in one of the unisex bathrooms (unisex bathrooms? that's crazy talk!!) that will jump out at you and eat your jiblets--but WHICH bathroom!?!? And...er...the bartenders stir the drinks with their fingers after they pick their noses and...um...it smells like poo and they only have that "what is love, baby don't hurt me" song on the jukebox playing over and over again all night and...er...

Ahh screw it, just go to Thieves.  But save me and my friends a booth, mmkay?
author: Kevin H.

description: I walked in and immediately on my left I see a photo booth, and Dru in an apron making free pancakes. This was just the beginning. I never got to try the bacon bloody mary, but I promise I will. The beautiful Pilar was serving me light beer since I had a serious pool game to play, and I didn't want to be uncoordinated. Whoever was controlling the jukebox was amazing. I would like to give him/her a hug. The pool tables were awesome, the waffles and pancakes smelled delightful, I (almost) won the pool tournament, and the company was fun.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
When I think of dive bars, I think of old, drunk, obnoxious regulars that can hardly speak coherent sentences, and bitch about how the neighborhood is getting taken over by yuppies while claiming that Joe Montana was the best quarterback ever!

I don't see that in the thieves because this place is classy, intimate, and sexy!  Great place to grab a shot of whiskey and PBR while enjoying conversation with a small group of friends.
author: Justin C.

description:
I went here for DYL last night.  It's a pretty chill place, they have Chimay on tap and the bartenders pour some good drinks.  The music isn't blaring and the people seem generally nice.  A little bit of a break from the traditional Mission bars.  I recommend it.
Check my pics:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/maidelba/sets/72157594541690118/
author: Mitch A.

description:
What a dive.

The bartender was beyond gone by the time we arrived and kept forgetting our drink order immediately after we told her again and again and again. And again. But only $15 for 3 top shelf, very strong cocktails? Rounds on me.
author: Deb I.

description:
I love this place, it's got spots to sit (nice half cresent loungy booths), good drinks, pool tables and a friendly crowd. 

It's also not another poshy club filled with wanks.
author: Beth M.

description:
What's a dive bar connoisseur to do?

On the one hand, I can't but help lament the bygone days of the Hush Hush and the darling, dirty girls and boys one encountered there. And I do miss the old Tavern in its glory Shotwell days.

On the other hand, this new Tavern is a lot closer to home and a good alternative to Zeitgeist if the pool table is taken there.

Good prices, good bartenders and my favorite bouncer from Mission Bar spends his free time there, which is always a good sign. Nothing particularly great about this place, just an all around decent neighborhood bar. 

Three slightly above average stars.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
I was recently in Canada. For a long time. Which is a frozen tundra of bourbonless misery. At least, none of the places I went to had it, and without Yelp Canada, I had few resources at my disposal for getting the low down on the local scene.  

Canadian Club tastes like maple syrup! Don't make me drink that ever again! I am a bourbon girl. 

Once I was safely back south of the border, in the Mission, my friend Duncan M. and I headed over to Thieves Tavern for a little happy hour and a catch up.  I ordered my Makers Mark straight up, and without any fuss or fan fare, I received a stern pour, reasonably priced.  God Bless America.
author: Rebecca H.

description: There's whiskey.  There's waffles.  It's a dive bar.  Jay is an awesome bartender.
author: Melanie C.

description: I went to a going away party at Thieves and left my expensive designer wallet on the bar (like a dummy). The bartender swiftly put it away for me and held onto it until I was able to pick it up a day later. It still had my cash and everything! It's rare these days to find honest good people who do the right thing. They have an awesome team over at Thieves and definitely will have my business for life!
author: Lissa-Moon L.

description: I love Thieves, I love whiskey, I love free samples of whiskey, I love Jay and his knowledge of whiskeys, I love free enormous Belgian waffles on Sunday, I love the house-made bourbon-maple whipped cream and honey butter that you can put on the waffles, I love pool tables where you can shoot without hitting the wall. The (unisex) bathrooms scare me from time to time though.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
Old Thieves was more my style.

-1 star:  Where the hell is Attack From Mars?  Uh, please tell me they didn't get rid of my favourite pinball game ever.
-1 star:  No more smoking.

Without those things it's just like any ol mission bar to me.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Supercoolplace.
Easygoingatmosphere.
Greatbartenders.
A great place to hang out with friends. Close enough to Mission, where if you get hungry later, there are places open late.
author: Kione E.

description:
Dice anyone?
The fellas from Thieves Tavern have moved over to the old Hush Hush location & done a great thing with the space! No longer is it a loony bin of cheapos getting drunk on quarter beer. No more awful dj action. Two pool tables for your pleasure and a delightful jukebox. $2 Oly, whoo hoo! Plus, two of the nicest bartenders in town! Great make-out booths with funky lil wooden tables.
author: Colleen B.

description: I really loved this place. Plenty to do, great pool table. Great TV's and really great service. I stopped by before the Giants game this last Monday. I'm an older guy, 48. A lot of times the bartenders at the little hole in the wall places pretty much just ignore non familiar, non hipster faces. But this girl was a real sweetheart. Really refreshing. Will be back again for sure.
author: Daniel T.

description:
It gains some points for being an unpretentious hangout, otherwise oft-referred to as a dive bar. The two pool tables and high-tech jukebox is nice too. But some points off for having a limited range of cocktails. The drafts selection wasn't large enough and sometimes the bottled stuff they keep isn't going to cut it. They could do without the token grumpy bartender too. Distressed service only hurts a business. If the guy gets that bent out of shape, a break, a shorter shift, or a different shift are just several alternatives.

I liked the Mandarin 7 he made me though. Dunno what's in it, but it's smooth and soda-citrusy.
author: Clar L.

description:
Love it!  It reminds of the the Twilight Exit in my hometown of Seattle.  It was an eclectic crowd of hipsters, locals, and regular folk just looking for a place to drink.

It was a nice laid back vibe with cheap beers in a bottle.  I love that they serve PBR and High Life in bottles ($3).  Although it was crowded, the bartenders were fast and friendly. 

I accidentally left my wallet on the bar after ordering some drinks.  When I realized that I had left it, the bartender made sure he placed it behind the bar so nobody would swipe it.  When I asked if he had it, kindly tossed it back to me all $5.63 cents, ID, and credit cards accounted for.  

If you're looking to drink in the Mission, skip all those bars on 16th and along Mission and head to Thieves.
author: Mike T.

description:
Cheap drinks, friendly bartenders, pool tables, juke box, what more could you want in a bar? Oh yah, friendly patron they have that too.

I had maybe 3 drinks and think that I paid for one of them and it was not that pricey either.
author: howard h.

description: A great little bar to start your evening in the mission. Friendly bartenders, comfy booths, pinball, and pool. check it out!
author: Nikki M.

description:
I'm still not sure why this place is named as such; they certainly don't jack you on the prices.  

Perhaps it's because this is a nice little bar tucked under Market street and somewhat away from the glow and commotion of most of the popular Mission bars.  We actually came in here realizing we might be too late for a last beer at Zeitgeist.

This place initially kind of struck me as a little weird.  Maybe it's just me but the place has quite a divey feel despite the rather posh looking bar.  No matter though, they serve up cheap PBR and High Life with the best of them.  I could've used a bit more of a diverse selection on the taps with Chimay being the most interesting thing on draught.  

It was pretty empty at around 1:30am on a Saturday night but it doesn't matter, here's a great place where you can play some pool and throw back a couple while making stupid jokes with your friends.  Props to the staff for being nice about last call - they provided the exact time we had to have our drinks done by, which is kind cool considering how dick some bouncer/bartender combos have been.

I realize I didn't get to spend much time here but the short exposure I had made me a fan.
author: Steven R.

description:
Great place to just go, hang out and grab a drink. And happy hour 5-8 every day, $3 beers, $3 wells. When i was there (hoping it's a normal thing) there was a bulleit special going on -- bulleit and a pbr for $6. super friendly bartender. Great art. Pool table. And all kinds of other fun games to borrow.

Will definitely be back.
author: Jon N.

description: This place is cool, less stodgy than other bars in the neighborhood.
author: Katherine D.

description: the bartenders were awesome!  went there on a saturday afternoon and got so much more than i expected.... the bloody mary was a lunch in itself with bacon and cherry tomato garnish and the free waffles were delicious. OMG what a way to spend a saturday afternoon. thank you!!!
author: Elaine Y.

description: Great neighborhood: cool atmosphere, professional bartenders, cheap drinks and a great place to watch the Giants in the World Series, even when they lose. I'll be back for BLT bloody marys and bourbon some other time (unless one of my teams is playing since this place is obviously a jinx bar).
author: Kendall D.

description:
Unpretentious, neighborhood bar that is conveniently located near Valencia Street, but is removed from the weekend warrior hysteria of the 16th St. and Valencia scene.

Friendly bartenders, two pool tables, and about four booths to accommodate larger groups.

You can make this spot be whatever you want it to be in a good way.
author: Brian S.

description: Nice place. It's really eclectic with clienteles. Hipster to uptown. Good prices for drinks, too.
author: Spike S.

description: Best $5 Manhattan in the city!!! The bartenders are super knowledgable and take a great pride in what they do. My kind of bar...
author: Hilde L.

description: Was here on a Saturday night. Too hot, too crowded, sausagefest, and the bartender refused to make their signature bloody mary because it was "too busy". Well, have an underpowered review on the house, mr. bartender...
author: Peter M.

description: Great little hole in the wall, went here last night.  Had no problem scoring a booth and isn't overly hipster.  Although there was a contingency of Baltimore Ravens fans which didn't bother me at all, just found it odd they were all gathered there.  Birds of a feather flock together.  Anyhow, there was a great special: Pabst 16oz, and a shot of whiskey for only 7 dollars!  Hallo!  Oh and the music rocked but wasn't overly loud so you couldn't hold a conversation with your drunk friends.  I'll be back for sure!
author: Charley C.

description:
Did my laundry right next door last night, and stopped in for a drink.  turns out I knew a few people there, and they had free hot dogs for Monday Night Football.  I'm not a huge football fan, but that hot dog sure went well with my beer.

Minus 1 star for the beer selection. (6 beers on tap, that I saw)
author: Joey R.

description: Good times were had by all, I think!  I went here for a social get together and it is definitely a great dive bar.  The service was awesome, friendly and I totally dug the happy hour prices,$3 well drinks, $2 beers.  It's a little dark, which is good, enough places to sit and converse with other drinking people.  Will drop by again!
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Love this place. Great bartenders, good drinks!!

Pool tables that are actually nice AND they have ok cues with chalk.

Chill neighborhood bar and NO annoying people, lets keep it that way.
author: Kara S.

description: Watched the world cup final here today. It was awesome, the bloody marys were flowing, and they were giving out free waffles and plates of spanish snacks (chorizo, patatas bravas, tortilla) that the guys made the night before. Bartender Oliver looked like the happiest, friendliest bartender I've ever seen. I would come back just to see him and have some of his good vibes rub off on me (that can be misinterpreted but I don't mind)
author: Carin R.

description:
Thieves Tavern is a kick ass local bar!  The bar is cozy with lots of character.  There is plenty of room to relax at the bar, in the booths or around the 2 pool tables.  They even had a state-of-the-art Internet Jukebox where you can request just about anything you would want to hear!  Plus they have a huge projection screen that plays sports or a movie.

Mia, Dave, Jeremy and Paul are all down to earth, great people.  They take care of their customers and really love what they do!

Anyone and everyone should visit Thieves Tavern if they are in the Mission.  You will have a great time!
author: Ruby K.

description:
I am a fan, I must say. Me, and 20 of my closest friends are always on the lookout for decent bars for our regular Tuesday night drinkathons. I love the vast and comfy seating options here, easily accomodating our motley crew. The pool tables and juke box are a definite plus to enhance and diversify the range of bar activites. Great bartender on Tuesday...fast, friendly, STIFF drinks and even threw in a shot to drink with him at the end of the night. 

The only downfall is that there are large, looming TVs hovering over certain areas. Some fear it distracts from paying attention to the real action.
author: Aron S.

description: *All* of the bartenders at Thieves are friendly and helpful and offer tastes when we ask for scotch recommendations (of course, we tip them for the tastes and then order a scotch).  Plus, the last time we were there, the tamale lady popped in.
author: Grace W.

description: Came here after Orbit decided to act like a dick and staff only 2 bartenders on a Friday night. Turned out to be an excellent decision. Think PBR tallboys were $3. We stayed for a few rounds while talking about personal prostitution prices. As it turns out, I'd be a pretty cheap whore. Oh yeah... heard they serve waffles in the morning!
author: Aaron Z.

description: This is a great bar, good drinks, lots of tables, couple of pool tables, grouchy bar tender what else do you need. Not sure if I would call this place a dive, it's a step up from a dive, even the quality of the tables, to the internet juke box put this on a different level. What this place has in common with dive bars is the feeling that you can come as you are, not judgments, just some drinking to be done.
author: Karl L.

description:
this place got the job done. it was a fun place to get drunk on a sunday night. they have pool and a jukebox. 

although i remember not loving the bartender but who knows, maybe she was having an off night.

also! it was during fleet week and the locks on the bathrooms arent so fantastic..a sailor interrupted my private time. an embarrassing memory but a hilarious one at that.
author: Britney K.

description: as far as dive bars go this is spot on.. spacious, good music, cheap alcohol, bartenders that know how to make drinks and good vibes all around.  I will definitely come back, and stay longer... oh and there will lil cookies there... so good!! yay!
author: blair k.

description:
Oooooh...this bar makes me wish I was still a whiskey swillin' slut whose idea of fun was a good bender that started at noon and lasted until I fell down and broke something. Thieves Tavern is a drinkin' bar for sure and the multitude of old school faces behind the bar only brings on fits of alcoholic nostalgia for the long gone days of being twenty-five and free of any sense of fiscal or corporeal responsibility. I love this place, but I can't go unless I've got a whole weekend to nurse the hangover that's going to come with it. 

Thieves Tavern, recently moved from its original location on Shotwell, has improved itself in size and upgraded to a full liquor license, which if you ask me, is always better. The place is all shiny-new still and still smelled a little of paint last I was there, but that will all go away soon. The upside is the felt on the pool tables is fresh and smooth, the jukebox is all tricked out with fun rocking, indie, country, poppy stuff and most of the bottles are still full. 

The four-star review rather than five is due simply to their mildly unadventurous beer selection. I know, I know, we can't all be Toronado, Zeitgeist or Lucky 13, but shooting for the common denominator is so dull. But I don't blame the guys who own the bar, I blame the drinking public who refuse to pull their heads out of their Heineken, their Bud or their Fat Tire long enough to realize that there is soooo much tasty and tastier beer... Alas, it is such an uphill battle. 

In conclusion: Good neighborhood bar. Good peeps. Burl-wood tables. Need I say more?
author: Sage R.

description: I really like Thieves Tavern, it's just as simple as that. Great vibe, decent drink prices, and off the beaten Mission path just enough to not get too crowded on most nights. The booths are comfortable and offer the perfect atmosphere for conversation with dates and small groups of friends. Last time I was in there the bar service was a little slow, but only because the bartender was actually taking the time to pour proper drinks and go out of his way to be polite and social to regulars and non-regulars alike. Pool table and awesome music selection scores TT some points too.
author: Natty S.

description: lots of whiskeys = yay! i'm a big fan of their $7 pbr and whiskey shot
author: Christopher L.

description: Monday night trivia night! As if you needed an excuse to drink at the start of the workweek, there's it is. Laid-back dark dive bar with friendly faces as far as the eye can see. Pool, pinball, video games, TVs... not much more to ask for in a place. Except being able to smoke, which you can. And not because they're above the law or below the search -- but because the bar is owner-operated (anti-smoking laws aren't aimed at protecting patrons/consumers, but protecting employees, if all the employees own the joint and agree to smoke, no problem). I love this place!
author: Mindful Indulgence S.

description: There's an evident vibe of community at this unmarked, barebones dive bar in the heart of the Mission District. Regulars arrive making the usual round of salutations before settling down at their favorite seat with a beer or glass of wine. An old-fashioned jukebox tunes offers just loud enough to inspire the occasional sing-along, but the main attractions tend to be the two mounted televisions that feature the perennial ball game. Pinball machines, video games, and a pool table entertain those who aren't sports fans, and it's also not uncommon to stumble upon a game of chess, scrabble, or liar's dice at one of the tables against the wall. The Thieves Tavern is a laidback, inconspicuous den, which is probably why it has eluded the city's no smoking ban.
author: Baochi N.

description: What a nice place, what nice people. someday they will own every bar in the city and legitimize drinking for good. I'm very fond of their jukebox, bartenders and awesome drink prices (sooo cheap). Also, pinball is always appreciated.
author: ida r.

description: My friend had done a search for bacon bloody mary's in San Francisco on a Sunday morning. We had a garden party to prepare for but a bloody mary never hurts anyone, right? We decided that we would go to Thieves because we read that they had a bacon, lettuce, tomato bloody mary and that just sounded too good to be true to us. Well, it turns out that on a Sunday it is too good to be true because those are made by the bartender who works on Saturday morning. Alas, we had a different bartender and a different bloody mary. I have a had MANY, MANY bloody mary's in my day, as it is one of my favorite drinks ever. I had never seen someone put orange juice in them before this guy did, along with about 30 other ingredients, it was pure magic in the making. The results were the best bloody mary I had ever had before and my friend agreed! These were spicy and smokey and about ten other flavors at once that were MAGIC! I had a good bloody last weekend but it had nothing on this art work! I will be returning, both on a Saturday for the BLT bloody and on a Sunday for this SMOKE SPICE STACK! (what I nick-named this bloody afterwards) P.S.  After one Bloody we had a silly buzz and carried on to get ourselves ready for the garden party, happily!
author: Deseray T.

description: It's like your favorite dive bar got an upgrade. Also, not crowded, but not empty.
author: Derek B.

description: rob is awesome!  good conversation, mellow atmosphere and some seriously good bloody mary's.  the only thing that makes this place better is the photobooth AND pool table.
author: Melissa C.

description: I like it so far.  It's plain, it's basic, the jukebox is okay, the bartenders are super nice.  I'm just so happy to have the last incarnation of the Hush Hush out of there.  That was just a depressingly boring place.  I just hope they don't become popular cuz it would be nice to have someplace near my apt that I can go to on a weekend without it being a madhouse.  And they serve $2 Olympia cans.   Nice to have another cheap alternative rather than just Pabst, which has gotten quite old.
author: Kerry L.

description: NOTE: 11/22/06 is their last day at 20th & Shotwell! They will move to the old Hush Hush location at 14th & Guerrero. I love this place and I look forward to checking out the new location.
author: Alan L.

description: My new favorite dive bar. Pool, photo hunt, cheap PBR, good scene, really nice bartender. Need I say more?
author: Alicia J.

description: Love it here. Great place to watch a game and relax after work. Probably my perfect neighborhood bar. Buy Justin a shot of whiskey.
author: Alex E.

description: Fun place. Good atmosphere. Kinda loud but what bar isn't? Chamay beers. Casual attitude. I give it a thumbs up.
author: Donovan W.

description: i've only been here a couple of times so far, but have every intention of going back many times in the future. i love that there are 2 pool tables and a jukebox. on one occasion i was there, the bartender provided the money for the jukebox with the stipulation that no one put on g'n'r. and something else i can't remember. but still. that is fair. on his dime. fair. it feels neighborhoody and a little divey but not seedy. i loved that the two times i've been there it hasn't been crowded. everyone gets to sit. doesn't seem rowdy or like a place the marina kids would go slumming it either. after a few more visits i'll probably have more to say. like for now.
author: Ashley A.

description: This is a great bar if you're in the neighborhood.  Off the beaten path of 16th Street, so usually there are fewer people than in those bars.  It's dimly lit, with friendly bartenders and a good jukebox.  You can sit at the bar or in one of the comfy booths and drink your whiskey special (a rotating whiskey and a tallboy of PBR).  Also has two pool tables, and a photo booth so you can preserve an image of your visit that you might otherwise not remember.
author: Seth W.

description: Bathroom was pretty gross. No soap, no toilet paper, but I guess that is what is expected at a dive bar.
author: Hilary P.

description: gotta love my corner bar.  but shhhh it's still a secret!  great jukebox, pool, pinball, smoking (double shhh) and friendly bartenders.   i knocked off one star for the distracting televisions.  but otherwise, it's a gem.  one of my most frequented bars!
author: Sharon M.

description: i'm so excited to have discovered my new neighborhood bar!  on my first visit i was warmly welcomed to the block by the very sweet mia and well taken car of behind the bar by jeremy.  the drinks were good, the prices cheap and the people fun and friendly.  i also loved the wooden tables in there and need to ask about them when i go back (i kind of want one for my apt).  so many stars for being so close to my place - i'm hoping to make it an extension of my living room ...
author: ali l.

description: Dependably good service, accessible on the weekends, and the everyday whiskey selection gets an A in my book. A great place to meet up with friends when you want to drink AND talk.
author: Celeste L.

description: After a bad time down the road i came here and had a blast, and got blasted. Good drink specials on Sat. night and some foreign girls tried to take me home, wich is always a plus!
author: Brendan M.

description: i was the only minority in the bar last night.  it was a bunch of mellow drunks drinking and playing pool.  the bartender was cool and hooked me up.  wish it was a smoking bar like their sister bar whiskey thieves.
author: Pickle R.

description: a little bit pubbish, a little bit punk rock, a little bit sports bar, but more of a neighborhood bar than anything else.  usually an open pool table and great whiskey specials; great little place to take over with a group or just grab a beer and play some pool with a friend.
author: Daryl F.

description: good is good....and then there's great.   this place is perfect for bs'ing with friends over a few games of pool.
author: Ivan S.
